loans.name: Karisa

texts.en: This is Karisa. He appreciates his previous Kiva loan that improved his living standards. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 KES to purchase more goats for resale. His previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income. He thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for resale

loans.name: Rizwan

texts.en:
Rizwan is 39 years old, married and the father of two children, living with his family in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Since 2001, he has been running a business of selling blankets and bedsheets, which is the only source of income for his family. 

Currently he is in need of expanding his business by adding more bedsheets and blankets. Due to financial constraints he finds it difficult, so he has requested a loan of PKR 100,000 from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help him to grow his business, but will increase his net income and savings as well. He wants to provide a quality education for his children. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy bedsheets and blankets for his shop.

loans.name: Rini

texts.en:
Rini is a housewife living with five persons in the family home in Cilegon. Cilegon is known as The City of Steel and is located about a three-hour drive from Jakarta. 

Rini owns a small stall that sells mobile phone airtime credits and services bill payments. For Rini, doing business in selling mobile phone airtime with Ruma is pretty helpful, especially when she needs urgent cash to fulfill family needs. She felt interested in joining Ruma because of her friend's recommendation. Ever since, her business has been assisted and supported by Ruma agents. 

For the last three months, she has had around $125-$126 per day in sales on average just from selling mobile phone airtime credits. She hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to process more transactions on weekends. 

In the future, Rini hopes that she will be able to improve her business and seek more business opportunities. Rini thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer and tools needed for her studies

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana de 53 años de edad desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza y venta de tilapias, comercializa las tilapias en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias ayuda en los gastos de hogar, vive en casa propia con sus hijos y su esposo, Ana está solicitando un crédito para la compra de alimento para tilapias y seguir con la crianza y asi poder hacer mas ventas y obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana is 53 years old and has been raising and selling tilapia for several years.  She sells them in the various markets located near her home.  Her earnings help with the household expenses.  She lives in a home of her own with her children and husband.  Ana is asking for a loan to buy tilapia feed so she can continue raising them and be able to increase her sales so she can provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy tilapia feed.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Alba de 55 años de edad, casada con dos hijos mayores de edad, es originaria de  la zona central del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable con ganas d superación personal. El negocio lo tiene por herencia de su madre, actividad que la disfruta mucho, ya que ha sido el medio de vida para apoyar a su familia económicamente.
Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la elaboración y venta de pasteles y repostería como tortas de pinas, cachos, semitas, dedos, maletas, picos, dulce de leche. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación y también por encargo, tiene 10 años de dedicarse a su negocio. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en materia prima y comprar la elaboración de repostería como harina, leche, cuajada, mantequilla, aceite, para aprovechar la temporada de Diciembre donde tiene la mayor demanda. Alba agradece la ayuda de los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Alba is 55 years old. She is married and has two grown children. She is a native of the central region of the country. She is a responsible and hard-working woman who has the desire to get ahead.

The business she has is an inheritance from her mother. It is something that she enjoys and it has been the way of life to support her family financially. Thanks to her effort and desire to get ahead she makes and sells pastries and cakes such as pineapple pie, cachos, semitas, dedos, maletas, picos and dulce de leche (traditional Nicaraguan pastries and sweets). Her bakery is located in her house and she has been in business for 10 years.

The objective of the loan is to invest in the raw material needed to make her pastries like flour, milk, cheese curd, shortening and oil. The holiday season in December brings her greatest sales. Alba is grateful to the lenders at Kiva who offer support to people of modest resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have dignified employment.

loans.use: to buy raw material to make cakes like flour, milk, cheese curd, shortening, butter and oil.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
As a way of generating income, Elvira runs a small variety store within her community. She aims to improve her store and make it profitable in order to help her husband in financing the education of her two youngest children. 

Elvira wants to acquire more stocks of grocery items to sell, but she has inadequate capital. In this regard, she is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy soft drinks, frozen foods, assorted candies, laundry soap, canned goods, noodles, food seasonings, and beverages to sell. She believes that, someday, she will make the business more profitable through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, frozen foods, assorted candies, laundry soap, canned goods, noodles, food seasonings, and beverages to sell.

location.town: Brgy. Parai, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Omari

texts.en:
Omari appreciates his previous Kiva loan that improved his living standards. He is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase more cows for resale. 

His previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income. He thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more cows for resale.

loans.name: Nyondo

texts.en:
This is Nyondo. He previously accessed a loan that he used to buy more goats for his business. His earnings were a big help for his personal, household, and business expenditures.

Beside the goat meat selling business, he sells fried fish. He is requesting a loan of ksh.10,000 to purchase more fish, cooking oil and firewood for his business. He appreciates Kiva's financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, cooking oil and firewood for his business

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr:
Maimouna, possède une mercerie dans le marché du quartier. Elle a démarré cette activité il ya plus de cinq ans. Maimouna est divorcée et se consacre carrément à son commerce. Elle vend de la garniture, mais aussi des tissus de tout genre. Avec l’événement de la fin d’année qui approche, elle sait qu’il y aura une forte demande du coté des tailleurs et  donc de son coté. Et pour préparer cela, elle sollicite un crédit de 500000F CFA pour pouvoir maximiser son profit.
Maimouna avec son statut, a la charge de veiller à ses enfants et à leur bien être. Grace aux bénéfices, elle s’occupe aussi de ses besoins personnels.
Elle rêve de diriger un grand centre de confection, coupe et couture avec un volet formation.
texts.en:
Maimouna owns a haberdashery shop in a local market. She began this business more than five years ago.

Maimouna is divorced and is completely dedicated to her business. She sells [sewing] supplies, but also fabrics of all kinds.

With the end of the year approaching, she knows that there will be a strong demand from tailors and her customers. To prepare for this, she is seeking a loan of 500,000 francs CFA so she can maximize her profits.

Maimouna is responsible for taking care of her children and their well-being. Thanks to her earnings, she can also take care of her personal needs.

She dreams of running a large sewing shop for making, cutting, and sewing [fabrics] and also training [people in this trade].

loans.use: to buy fabric and haberdashery to resell

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard appreciates his previous Kiva loan that improved his living standards and enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income. 

He is requesting a loan of KES 10,000 to purchase bales of clothes for resale. He thanks Yehu Microfinance Trust for its financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Priscila

texts.en:
Priscila is a married  mother of two children who go to school. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For years, Priscila has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. She dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase  wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase  wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
This is Emma. She previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and cover maintenance costs of her computer shop. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in for her family’s personal, household and business expenditures.
 
Emma is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to buy additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family’s daily needs and provide for the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. In the future, Emma hopes to be more successful in her business and dreams to give her children a good life and education. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Ricardo Antonio

texts.es:
Ricardo, opta por otro crédito para fortalecer el su negocio de reparación de reparación de reparación de llantas, con esta inversión comprara silicón, llantas, parches, neumáticos, etc., con lo que seguirá dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
Con el préstamo anterior pudo adquirir productos que necesitaba para equipar su negocio, atraer más clientes sus ingresos han mejorado, cancelo puntualmente su deuda, hasta la fecha sigue trabajando sin ningún problema.
texts.en: Ricardo has decided to request another loan to strengthen his business of repairing tires. With this loan he will buy tires, silicon, patches, etc to be able to continue offering good service to his customers. With his last loan he was able to buy the products he needed to equip his business, attract more clients and increase his revenues. He was able to pay off his loan punctually and up to now has been able to work with no problems.

loans.use: to buy silicon, tires, patches, etc.

loans.name: Joaquín

texts.es:
Joaquín, se dispone a surtir el inventario de su tienda, invertirá en la compra de golosinas, juguetes, bebidas, por mayor para aprovechar que esta temporada las ventas aumentan y atraer más clientes.
Con el crédito anterior tuvo la ayuda para mejorar sus ganancias con la cuales ha podido cancelar su crédito y hoy cuenta con automóvil con el que sale a vender a los pueblos con el fin de tener más ingresos extras.
texts.en:
Joaquín wants to stock up his shop.  He will invest in sweets, toys, and drinks.  He will buy in bulk and take advantage of the fact that sales increase at this time of year and he will attract more customers.

With his previous loan, Joaquín was able to increase his income, with which he could pay off his loan.  He now has a car which he uses to sell his products in other towns, giving him an extra income.

loans.use: to buy sweets, toys and drinks.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana, se ha decidido por otro crédito para invertir en los insumos  necesarios para la elaboración de la venta de tamales y comida, comprara verduras, maíz, aceite, pollo, hojas, leña y condimentos y bolsas. Hoy en día tiene mucho más clientela por ello sus ingresos son mejores.
Con el préstamo anterior ella surtió su inventario y pudo seguir trabajando sin ningún problema, con los nuevos ingresos ha cancelado sus deudas y compro láminas con las que mejoro s u vivienda.
texts.en:
Juana has decided to take out another loan to invest in the supplies she needs in order to make tamales and other food.  Juana will buy vegetables, corn, oil, chicken, tinfoil, firewood, condiments and bags.  Juana now has many more customers and so she earns a higher income.

Juana used her previous loan to stock up and she was able to continue working with no problems.  With her increased income, Juana has paid off her debts and bought metal laminate sheeting to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, corn, oil, chicken, tinfoil, firewood, condiments and bags.

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Meet 38-year-old Rugiatu from Waterloo2, Western rural area, in Sierra Leone. She is married with four children. 

In 2001, Rugiatu established her retail business. She began her business because she wants to empower herself. She works at the business ten hours per day and six days per week.  She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and insufficient capital to expand her business.

Rugiatu requires a loan in order to purchase more cigarettes, drinks, soap and pure water. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. 

In the future, Rugiatu plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cigarettes, drinks, soap and pure water.

loans.name: Mariagina

texts.en:
Mariagina is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a mini shop that helps her to generate income for her family.

She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as shirts, shorts, long pants, long sleeved shirts, short sleeved shirts, and clothes for pregnant women. She opened her mini shop a year ago with her own working capital of $600.  She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy shirts, shorts, long pants, long sleeved shirts, short sleeved shirts, and clothes for pregnant women

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Meet 32-year-old Margaret from Waterloo, Western rural in Freetown in Sierra Leone. She is married with two children. For the past 10 years, Margaret has been running her retail food business. She began her business because she wanted to contribute to taking care of her children. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 5:30 pm, 6 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and proper business location.

Margaret requires a loan in order to purchase more onions, fresh eggs and cooking seasonings. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Margaret plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more onions, fresh eggs and cooking seasonings

loans.name: Shabana's Group

texts.en:
Shabana is aged 36, living with her four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a mechanic by profession; he repairs and renews punctured tyres of vehicles. He has been doing this business for many years. He provides the services near the road. He wants to offer new tyres and tubes as well but he does not have enough cash in hand to make the purchasing. Most of his customers request new tyres and tubes but he has to refuse them. 

Therefore, Shabana requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy new tyres, tubes and inner tube repair patches.

Shabana thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy tyres and tubes for puncture repair services.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la clienta de 24 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella tiene un negocio de venta de tortillas y pupusas desde hace varios años, el cual le ha ayudado a poder salir adelante con los gastos que se le presentan en el hogar, es una mujer muy trabajadora, responsable, honesta y siempre esta buscando la manera de que a su familia no le falte nada, ahora la clienta quiere mejorar su vivienda repellando las paredes, pintándola y construyendo un cuarto para su hijo, pero con lo que obtiene de su trabajo y con la ayuda de su esposo no logran poder realizarlo, por esa razon esta solicitando un credito para la compra de arena, cemento, ladrillos, pintura, etc. para poder mejorar su vivienda y asi ella y su familia puedan vivir mas comodos.
texts.en:
This client is 24 years old.  She lives in her own home with her husband and child.  For several years, she has had a business selling tortillas and pupusas.  Her business has helped her to keep up with the expenses that arise for her household.  She is a very hardworking, responsible, and honest woman.  

She is always looking for a way to make sure her family is lacking for nothing.  Now she wants to improve her home by plastering the walls, painting them, and adding a room for her child.  With what she earns from her job and with the help of her husband, she still can’t make it happen, so she is asking for a loan to buy sand, cement, bricks, paints, etc., so that she can improve her home.  In this way she and her family can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, bricks, paint, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is 60 years old, married, and blessed with four children. She manages a hog raising business and earns a net income of 3,500-4,000 PHP per hog. Leticia’s profits are usually spent on rental payments for a hand tractor and other farm equipment for her corn farming business. 

Leticia is requesting a 40,000 PHP loan to purchase hog feed. She will use her profits to increase her capital and help her corn farm earn more income. Leticia is hoping that her businesses will continue to become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Reyna de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia ella se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia ya tiene  clientela fija que la prefieren por que su producto es de muy buena calidad y a buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Reyna quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo unos cuartos para ampliar mas su casa por esa razon solicita un credito para la compra de los materiales necesarios como: cemento, arena, hierro, ladrillos, pago de mano de obra, etc. y asi ella y su familia puedan vivir comodos y seguros.
texts.en:
Reyna, age 47, lives in her own home with her family.  She works in agriculture, sowing corn and beans.  She sells her crops in the various markets that are found near her home.  She has an established clientele who prefer her because her crops are of a high quality and a good price.  With what she earns from her sales, she can cover some of her household expenses.  

Reyna wants to improve her home, adding a few rooms to increase the size of her house.  Because of this she is asking for a loan to buy the necessary materials, such as: cement, sand, iron, and bricks, and to pay for the labor, etc.  In this way she and her family can live comfortably and securely.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, and bricks, and to pay for labor, etc.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 35 years old and is very responsible with her household obligations, since she has always been known to provide the best for her family. She currently lives with her husband and three children. She is a farmer who plants corn and coconuts.

Lolita wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer, among other items, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nerie

texts.en: Nerie has been farming for more than four years to make a living. She grows assorted plants on her own farm while raising pigs to sell. She earns well from these activities and has successfully repaid her previous loans from GDMPC that she used for her farm. Recently, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC to purchase fertilizer in order to boost her farm.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Julie Ann

texts.en:
Julie Ann is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Julie Ann has been in this business for five years. Julie Ann earns more income from general store.

Julie Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to maintain her motorcycle

loans.name: Ma. Lory

texts.en:
Ma. Lory is 23 years old and married, with two children, one in school.  Ma. Lory works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Lory runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like sugar, soft drinks, coffee, etc., to sell.  She has been in this business for three years.

In the future Ma. Lory would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like sugar, soft drinks, coffee, etc., to sell

loans.name: Ma. Cheryl

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Ma. Cheryl works hard to support her family.

She has a DVD rental (entertainment) business in the Philippines, and she also earns income from food vending. 

Ma. Cheryl is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to purchase more new DVDs for her business.

Ma. Cheryl has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more DVDs for her rental business

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 69 years old, married to Jane, and they are blessed with three children aged between 10 and 19 years, He runs a rental houses business in Kapsabet.
 
He has been in this business for the last nine years, and from this business he gets a monthly profit of KES. 45,000. He has borrowed a loan of KES. 100,000 which he will use to purchase building materials to built more rental houses.
 
With the anticipated profits he will pay his children's school fees and make the  loan repayment. His dream is to give the best to his family as the breadwinner as well as expand his business to a point where he will be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase building materials

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
This is Jocelyn, 38, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. Her partner is Jose, a construction foreman, and she is a mother to their children. She, together with her partner, manages their household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Jocelyn maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are counting on as their income. Jocelyn also sells peanut butter for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 2000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business.

Jocelyn hopes to expand her business and dreams of having a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana lives in Bogor, a suburban area located about an hour from Jakarta. She joined Ruma because she wants to expand her business. She runs a small stall called "warung", a typical corner store in Indonesia that sells snacks, drinks, etc. She also sells mobile phone airtime credits and servicing of bill payments for customers. Previously, she took a working capital loan from Kiva and she paid it back on time. Currently, she is taking another loan from Kiva because she sees a sales opportunity on weekends as more customers come to her small shop to buy mobile phone airtime credits. For the last few months, she was able to process around 9-10% higher sales volume on weekends than on weekdays. Ana hopes that she can improve her small stall that she runs and add the extra cash to her family's savings. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama is 29 years old and married, with four children. She runs a local food business in Waterloo, a western, rural area in Freetown.

She has been in this business for 12 years and she sells palm oil, beans, and charcoal within a busy market area. Her business is the only source of income she has. She says that her business is going well.

Mariama requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone Microfinance Company Limited, to purchase more local food for resale, like palm oil, charcoal, rice, and beans. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her educate her children and increase her business. 

In the future, Mariama would like to further expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more local food for resale, like palm oil, charcoal, rice, and beans.

loans.name: Teresinha

texts.en:
A $1000 loan is offered to Teresinha to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as  noodles, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, salt,milk, Fanta, Coca-Cola. Sprite and water. She has been involved in business activities since 2010. She feels comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Teresinha independent because she can be responsible for herself and also helping her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy noodles, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, salt, milk, Fanta, Coca-Cola. Sprite and water

loans.name: Pastor

texts.es:
Pastor, vive con su compañera de vida y dos hijos de 10 y 8 años de edad, se dedica a realizar viajes para trasladar arena, piedra y ladrillo,  para proyectos municipales y particulares. Su horario es de 3:00 a.m. hasta las 2:00 p.m. Por el momento no ha tenido ningún problema en realizar esta actividad.
Invertirá en darle mantenimiento al vehículo, como revisión de frenos, cambio de aceite, entre otros, que le permitan tener un vehículo en las condiciones adecuadas para trabajar y seguir aportando para los gastos de su hogar, espera aumentar su rentabilidad, dar un buen servicio y mejorar su economía.
Sueña con construir su casa nueva para darle un techo a su familia.
texts.en:
Pastor lives with his life partner and two children who are 10 and 8 years old.  His work is transporting sand, stone and brick for municipal projects and individuals. His schedule is from 3:00am to 2:00pm.  For the moment, he has not had any problems in accomplishing this work.

He will invest in providing maintenance for his vehicle, like changing the brakes, and changing the oil, etc.  This will allow him to have a vehicle in proper condition to work and continue contributing to the household expenses.  He hopes to increase his profitability, to provide good service, and to improve his economic situation.

He dreams of building a new home to provide a roof over his family's head.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more blood syrup, pain tablets, malarial drugs and cholera drugs for resale.

loans.name: La Divina De La Union Group

texts.es: La Sra. Lourdes  de  41   años de edad casada  y madre de  2 hijos, la Sra. Lourdes  tiene una pequeña bodega   ya hace unos  6 años. La Sra. Lourdes  ,  ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus productos y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más productos para su bodega  (arroz, azúcar, menestras, etc.)   Y así seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes   y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  la Sra. Lourdes   y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos   con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado   y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. La Sra. Lourdes   esta parada es la primera de la mano derecha y  se le distingue por su polo morado ,   Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 41 years old, is married and has two children.  She has had a small grocery store for the past six years and has been able to build loyalty with her customers which has generated income for her to cover her household expenses. In the future she would like to have her own store where she can sell her products and earn more money. She will use the loan to invest in more products for her store (rice, sugar, vegetables, etc.) and continue to meet the needs of her customers while improving her situation. 

Lourdes and all the members are grateful to Kiva for the loan and for the confidence they have been shown. Lourdes is the one standing and is the first one on the right, wearing a purple shirt. She promises that she will meet all of her pledged goals.

loans.use: to buy products.

loans.name: Dúo Perlas De Oro Group

texts.es:
DUO PERLAS DE ORO
Doña Ana Cristina es originaria de la aldea xetzac, del municipio de Tecpán, ella tiene 35 años de edad, bajo su responsabilidad están sus cuatro hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de sandalias.
Ella empezó con un pequeño negocio, y gracias a Dios poco a poco a podido salir adelante, ahora ya su negocio a crecido ya cuenta con otras maquinas para la elaboracion de su productos gracias al apoyo de Kiva y al apoyo de su esposo, ella sigue trabajando con su negocio, ya que por medio de su negocio ha podido salir adelante y darles lo necesario a sus hijos.
El sueño de ella es poder ampliar mas su negocio, hacer otros estilos de sandalias surtirlo con mas variedad de productos, asi podrá tener mejores ganancias y poder mandar sus hijos a la escuela.ella ya ha trabajado 2 creditos anteriores y no cayo en mora es muy responsable en sus pagos, esperando que nuevamente le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado
texts.en:
Doña Ana Cristina is originally from the village of Xetzac in the municipality of Tecpán.  She is 35 years old and has four minor children under her care.  She is engaged in the manufacture and sale of sandals.

She started with a small business, and thank God gradually was able to get ahead.  Now her business has grown and she relies on other machines for the production of her products.  With the support of Kiva and of her husband she continues working with the business.  Through her business she has progressed and provided the necessities for her children.

Her dream is to expand her business to produce other styles of sandals and to stock her business with a larger variety of products.  She wants to accomplish this so that she may have a better income and to be able to send her children to school.  She has worked with 2 previous loans and not fall into arrears; she is very responsible with her payments.  Doña Ana Cristina is hoping you can once again help with the requested loan.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the manufacture of footwear (sandals).

loans.name: Sokin

texts.en:
Sokin is 27 years old and is a married man. He has been blessed with one child who is 4 years old. Sokin works hard at the rice fields to manage his daily farming chores and has a great support from his wife. He has been engaged in farming business for over five years and also works as a paid laborer to have additional income for his family.

With the aim to improve sanitation and keep his family healthier, Sokin is going to use his loan to buy construction materials needed to build a household latrine and pay for labor costs. Thanks to the water loan program offered by HKL with a special rate. It has encouraged Sokin to focus on ensuring healthful living conditions to safeguard the health of his family and protect the environment.

loans.use: to buy construction materials needed to build a household latrine and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es: jose de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, es empleado de una empresa privada en la cual tiene varios años de laborar ahi, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, jose esta solicitando un credito para poder mejorar su vivienda construyendo las paredes de los cuartos ya que los tiene construidos con laminas asi como los muestra en la fotografía, con lo solicitado podra comprar cemento, hierro, ladrillos, arena, pago de mano de obra, etc. y asi puedan vivir mas seguros con su familia.
texts.en:
Jose, age 37, lives in his own home with his family.  He is an employee of a private company, where he has worked for a number of years.  With what he earns from his job he is able to take care of some of the household expenses.  

Jose is asking for a loan in order to be able to improve his home.  He will be building walls for the rooms, because they were constructed from metal sheeting, as the photograph shows.  With the loan he is requesting, he will be able to buy cement, iron, bricks, and sand, and will be able to pay for labor, etc.  In this way he can live with his family more securely.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron, bricks, and sand, and to pay for labor, etc.

loans.name: Carlos Jose

texts.es: El señor Carlos a sus 56 años de edad lucha a diaria para salir adelante y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, su actividad comercial es la venta y cultivo de Plantas hornamentales desde hace 25 años, el credito lo solicita para la compra de Plantas, Fertilizantes, Bolsas platicas para sembrar semilla. asi su vivero estara ofreciendo variedad y los clientes lo visitaran mas y sus ganancias aumentara, Agradece el apoyo que Kiva en conjunto a Afodenic le han brindado.
texts.en: 56-year old Sr. Carlos works hard every day to get ahead and improve his standard of living. He has run a nursery growing and selling plants for 25 years. The loan he is seeking will be used to buy plants, fertilizer, and plastic bags in which to grow seeds. The nursery will have a greater variety and more customers will visit leading to more income for Carlos.  He is grateful to Kiva and Afodenic for the help they have provided

loans.use: Buy plants and fertilizer

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is thankful for the financial assistance previously extended to her. She was able to use her loan to buy more products for her variety store and to help in her junk shop. Myrna’s business income helps assist her family with their everyday household expenditures. She runs a general store and she and her husband both work hard to provide for their family’s everyday needs.

Myrna is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at her store the better as more items to sell will result in better profit. Myrna’s profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and she looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. In the future, she dreams that her business will be more flourishing and hopes that she and her husband can travel. Myrna meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
Kristine has been selling home products for five years now, and her business continues to grow. She is thankful for the previous financial assistance extended to her, as she was able to buy more merchandise to sell. Kristine's loan was also helpful in the education of her children. Her income is helping  to pay for the family's everyday household expenditures as she and her husband work hard to provide for their everyday needs. 

Kristine is now requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP to buy merchandise and products needed in her business such as electric fans, rice cookers, flat irons, bags, etc. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Kristine hopes to be more successful in business and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. This is where she finds strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise and products such as electric fans, rice cookers, flat irons, bags, etc.  needed in her business.

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es:
Karla, tiene 20 años de edad, vive junto a su compañero de vida en casa propia, debido a la necesidad de dar apoyo a su compañero de vida en los gastos familiares, por iniciativa propia instalo en su hogar una pupuseria, la cual atiende todo los días. No se le dificulta estar pendiente de su negocio ni de su hogar.
Invertirá en la compra de quesillo, chicharrón, aceite, y aderezos, para surtir su inventario y seguir trabajando sin inconvenientes, espera ampliar su negocio, atender mejor a sus clientes, aumentar sus ventas, mejorar su economía para cancelar la deuda.
 Sueña con tener un negocio más rentable que le permita seguir apoyando a su compañero de vida en los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Karla is 20 years old. She lives with her life companion in their own house. Due to the necessity of helping her life companion with the household expenses she opened a small store in her house on her own initiative. She works in it every day. She has no problem taking care of the business and managing her household.

Karla will invest the loan in purchasing cheese, pork cracklings, oil and seasonings to stock her store. She hopes to increase her sales, improve her finances and pay off her debt. She dreams of having a more profitable business that will permit her to continue supporting her life companion with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy cheese, pork cracklings, oil and seasonings.

loans.name: Leonidas Alexander

texts.es:
Leónidas, solicita capital para invertir en la recolección de la cosecha, con el crédito pagara mano de obra y pagara una maquina desgranadora, así como también pagara el traslado del producto a su casa.
Con el préstamo anterior aumento su producción, sus granos fueron de calidad, aumentaron sus ventas, sus ingresos son mayores, ya que conto con los insumos necesarios para sembrar. Su familia se mantiene con el mismo grupo familiar y todos se encuentran muy saludables.
texts.en: Leónidas is requesting capital to invest in harvesting his crops. He will pay for labor and pay for a thrashing machine and transporting the product to his house.  With his last loan his grain was of high quality. He increased his sales and his profits were greater as he had the supplies he needed to plant. His family is all together and all are in good health.

loans.use: to invest in harvesting his crops.

loans.name: Rita Liliam

texts.es: La señora Rita, tiene 38 años tiene dos hijos de siete y doce años, ella se dedica armado de estantes de fierro en su tornería,   vive en la zona de  Villa Adela donde es su taller, este préstamo es la primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la señora Ritava a usar este préstamo para la compra de una maquina cortadora de fierro,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que tiene mucho trabajo que hacer ya la que tiene no le abastece para realizar su trabajo,  y va a utilizar los beneficios en el crecimiento del negocio su deseo  para  su negocio es tener mayores ingresos y apoyar a la familia  económicamente y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rita is 38 years old and has 2 children, ages 7 and 12. She assembles iron shelves in her lathe shop.	Rita lives in the Villa Adela zone where she also has her shop. This is her 1st loan with this institution. 

Rita will use the loan to purchase an iron-cutting machine. Her reason for soliciting the loan is that she has much work that can not be done with her current equipment. She will utilize these benefits to grow her business. 

Rita's desire for the business is to produce greater income, helping her family economically and, thus, to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an iron-cutting machine.

loans.name: Mukuche

texts.en:
Mukuche appreciates his previous Kiva loan that he used to improve his living standards and expand his business and income. He has a motorcycle transport business.

Mukuche is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to purchase spare parts and repair his motorcycle. He thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Munga

texts.en:
Munga is married with two children, one in school and the other still underage. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Munga has operated a clothes-selling business for the past six years. He sells to his town dwellers, passersby and neighbors. He faces a major challenge of inflation in his business. 

With the KES 30,000 he wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, alcohol, and cigarettes for resale.

loans.name: Ira

texts.en:
Ira lives in Bogor, a suburban area located about an hour from Jakarta. Ira is a factory worker who runs a small stall that sells mobile phone airtime credits and services bill payments for the customers. She joined Ruma because she's interested in expanding her business. Previously, she took a working capital loan from Kiva and she has already paid it back on time. 

Now, Ira is requesting another loan from Kiva because she sees sales opportunities on weekends as more customers come to her small shop to buy mobile phone airtime credits. Over the last months, she has been able to process around 8-9% higher sales volume on weekends than on weekdays. Ira hopes that she can improve the small stall that she runs and put aside the extra cash for her family's savings. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy general stock like rice, cement, flour and sugar for resale

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is 31 and married. He lives in Taiz, Yemen, with his family. Mohammed has completed a bachelor's degree and has been operating an Internet café for a year. He started his business because he needed an income and was able to self-finance. Mohammed employs one person and has four computers. He is comfortable with his business because he realizes that he offers knowledge and services for his clients rather than simply providing a commercial service. 

Mohammed is requesting a 200,000 YER loan from AMB to buy computers to stock his business. He wants to expand his range of offerings and begin to sell computers to increase his income. In the future, Mohammed would like to study for his master's degree so that he can shape a prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy computers

loans.name: Laily

texts.en:
Laily is a rural woman, 37 years old, who is married to Nazrul, 41.  Laily passed class IV (grade 4), but her husband is illiterate and can only sign his name. They live in the small village Barosoria in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri, with their three children. They have a small kachha house (mud, wood and straw made). Their son is a mason by profession and their daughters got married.

Laily works in animal husbandry; her husband is a farmer. He has got a small inherited land where he grows different vegetables in different seasons. They work hard from dawn to dusk, yet they are unable to cover all the expenses of the family.

Laily decided to help her husband financially. She learned that Kiva’s partner BJS offers loans to rural women to start businesses. She applied for a loan to buy a dairy cow to start a milk supply and dairy products business. Today there is a great demand for dairy products like milk, ghee, curd, cheese, paneer, etc. in the village market, so she has a great interest in purchasing a cow to earn more income. 

Her ambition is to build a pacca house (made of cement and brick) with the profit from her own business, and to give good education to her children. In future she will buy more cows to extend her business on a large scale.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Parveen, a 43-year-old married woman, lives in a village in an area of Lahore, Pakistan where transportation services are limited. Her husband provides  transportation to passengers with his horse cart.

Because her husband's horse has grown old, Parveen is requesting  a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so he can buy a new one in order to  continue his services. Parveen wants to save some of the profits amount for the future needs of her children. She thanks Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support.

loans.use: To buy a horse for her husband's transportation service.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro de 34 años de edad reside junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 8 años y 2 meses de edad.  Pedro se dedica a la comercialización de dulces al menudeo desde hace mucho tiempo. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos ha tomado la decisión de ampliar su negocio de dulces y así poder dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de variedad de dulces al por mayor y así aumentar sus ventas e ingresos y por consecuencia su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is 34 years old, and lives with his wife and their two children who are 8 years old and 2 months old.  Pedro has worked in retail selling candy for a very long time.  This is how he earns a living for his family.  

With the goal of increasing his earnings, he has made the decision to expand his candy business in order to improve his family's living conditions.  For this reason, he is seeking this loan from FUSAI to invest in purchasing a variety of candy in bulk, which will allow him to increase his sales and earning, and in so doing, improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of candy in bulk.

loans.name: Lopepe

texts.en:
Lopepe is 42 years old and married with five children. 

She has a small garden where she grows taros, yams and bananas so that she can sell them in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. Lopepe needs a loan to buy chemicals, a backpack sprayer, bush knives, files, an empty water gallon for water storage, iron roofing and cement for home improvement. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Lopepe will use the profits from her sales to support her family and also her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a backpack sprayer, bush knives, files, iron roofing, cement, and an empty water gallon for water storage.

loans.name: Leiua

texts.en:
Leiua is 43 years old and married with two children. 

She has a small garden where she grows taros, bananas and yams so that she can sell them in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Leiua needs a loan to buy fertilizers, chemicals, barbed wire, a backpack sprayer, bush knives and taro root crops. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Leiua will use the profits from her sales to support her family and also her kids' schooling.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, chemicals, barbed wire, a backpack sprayer, bush knives and taro root crops.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en:
Dilbar, who has run a sewing business since 2000, lives with her husband and five children. Her husband works in Russia, where his salary is low, as do her two sons. 

Since last year, Dilbar has been rebuilding her house and there is still some work to be done to finish it completely. The loan of 7000 somoni that she has requested will be dedicated to buying some building materials needed in this project.

loans.use: To buy materials for rebuilding her house

loans.name: Aminjon

texts.en:
Aminjon is a very clever boy. He graduated school with excellence and good marks. He was one of the best pupils of his school. He likes math, computers, geography, and other subjects. His hobby is playing football. His classmates like him very much. 

This year he has entered to the National University of Tajikistan, the faculty of law. His parents are workers. Their income is too small to pay for Aminjon’s study at the university. Aminjon wants to be one of the best lawyers in his town. He is purposeful and hardworking. He is asking for a loan of $2,000 to pay for study at the university. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida is 43 years old. She is a widow and lives with her daughter who is 16 years old. Her daughter entered university this year.

Saida opened her small grocery store business on the plot of land where they live. She had been running her business successfully for 16 years. A few months ago, she got sick and had to stay in hospital to get treatment. Because of this, her business was weakened. She is now well and requesting a loan of 1,500 AZN to purchase inventory to restart her grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her grocery store.

loans.name: Dul

texts.en:
Dul is an experienced farmer from the village of Santuk district in Kampong Thom province. He is 34 of age and married with one child who is attending local school. To make a living, Dul plants and harvests rice, which he keeps in a barn for the whole year food and also sells in the local markets for money. He has been engaged in this occupation for nearly 15 years and earns approximately $4.54 per day.

Dul would like to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation. He will use the loan to build a safe latrine at home, so everyone in his family can use it comfortably. Thanks to the water loan program offered by HKL with a special rate. It has encouraged Dul to focus on ensuring healthful living conditions to safeguard the health of his family and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a safe latrine at home, so everyone in his family can use it comfortably.

loans.name: Rosa Danelia

texts.es: Rosa, tiene 51 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y vive en el municipio de Arizona, Atlántida junto con sus hijos y un nieto. Hace muchos años que pudo conseguir un local en el mercado donde vende comidas típicas como baleadas, pastelitos, tacos, tortilla con quesillo, almuerzos, churros, refrescos y otros. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras, para surtir de frutas como uva, manzanas, insumos para elaborar las comidas como arroz, frijoles, carnes, manteca y refrescos. Su objetivo es aprovechar la buena temporada y obtener ingresos para mejorar su casa y el local del negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is 51 years old. She is a single mother with three children and lives in the municipality of Arizona, Atlántida with her children and grandson. For many years now she has run a stall in the market where she sells local food such as baleadas (wheat flour tortillas), pastries, tacos, tortillas with cheese, lunches, doughnuts, soft drinks etc. 

Rosa is seeking a loan of 10,000 lempiras to buy ingredients such as fruit (grapes, apples), rice, beans, meat, butter and drinks for the food she makes. Her goal is to make the most of this lovely time of year to earn more money so she can make improvements to her house and business.

loans.use: Buy fruit such as grapes and apples, rice, beans, meat, butter and soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase used clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, alcohol and cigarettes for resale.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is 32 years old and married with three children between the ages of 4 and 10 years. He runs a cosmetic business in Masuba in the northern area in Sierra Leone.

He has been in this business since 2001 and sells a variety of cosmetics within a busy market area.  He says that the main challenges to his business are transportation problems and storage facilities.

Anthony requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more cream, body shampoo, and hair relaxer for resale. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him increase his business and build a house. In the future, Anthony would like to expand his business more than ever.

loans.use: to purchase more cream, body shampoo, and hair relaxer for resale

loans.name: Zuma

texts.en:
Zuma is a married man who is very hardworking and responsible. He lives at his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For the past four years, he has operated a bodaboda (motorcycle) transport business. His potential customers are town dwellers. He cites high cost of maintenance as being his major challenge. 

With the Kshs 18,000 he wants to purchase spare parts and paint his motorcycle. He joined Yehu to access loans to improve his living standard.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and paint his motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, zinc, nails, door locks, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Mahfooz

texts.en:
Mahfooz is 33 years old, married and the father of five children, most of whom are in primary school. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is a food distributor selling fruits and vegetables using his rickshaw. He is very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic, and he makes every effort to come out ahead. This business is the only source supporting him and his big family. 

Mahfooz took out a loan of 100,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank in order to purchase enough fruits and vegetables to meet the demand of his clientele, since this will bring more profit to him and his family's conditions will improve accordingly. This loan will allow him to  build a good relationship with his clientele by serving their needs.

loans.use: to purchase enough fruits and vegetables to meet the demand of his clientele

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is the mother of six children. She is living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a fruit seller and has sold fresh fruits from a shop in the nearby town for many years. He  offers seasonal and fresh fruits to his customers. He has been feeding his family through income generated from the fruit shop.

Nowadays, the needs of his family have suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs, so he decided to expand his current enterprise. He wants to increase the stock on a daily basis so that he could generate maximum income out of the fruits sales.

Therefore, Kalsoom requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy extra seasonal fruits.

loans.use: To buy fresh and seasonal fruits to sell.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is 44 years old, a married woman and mother of five children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Jamila has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and little bit of engine maintenance for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of an auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Usman

texts.en:
Mr. Usman is a 28-year-old married man and active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. He has a wife and two children. Usman's wife is a very hardworking and responsible housewife who always helps her husband. Since 2004, Usman has been running a cosmetics shop which is the only source of income for his family. Currently he is in need of purchasing more cosmetics products to expand his business, but due to financial constraints he finds it difficult. 

For that reason, he has requested a loan amount of 100,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help him to grow his cosmetics business but will increase his net income and savings as well. He desires to provide quality education to his children. He is very much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To pay for cosmetics for his shop.

loans.name: Arshad

texts.en:
Arshad is a 51-year-old married man who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with his family. He is an active BRAC Pakistan borrower. Arshad’s wife is a very hardworking and responsible housewife. Since 2004, he has been running a uniform-selling shop which is the only source of income for his family. Currently, Arshad is interested in purchasing another shop to expand his business but finds this difficult due to financial constraints. 

Arshad is requesting a 200,000 PKR loan from the Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to pay for purchasing another shop. His loan will not only help him grow his business but will also increase his net income and savings. Arshad hopes to provide a quality education for his children. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase another shop

loans.name: Isapela

texts.en:
Isapela is a 32-year-old married woman with two children. 

She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Isapela has requested a loan to buy chemicals, weedkiller, bush knives, a wheelbarrow and a spade. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. With her profits, Isapela hopes to save for her children's education and to support her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, weedkiller, bush knives, a wheelbarrow and a spade.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the following: perfumes, makeup, blush, lipstick, nail polish and video games.

loans.name: Jesus Wilfredo

texts.es: Jesús de 31 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos. Jesús se dedica al comercio de tienda desde hace 8 años. Es muy conocido en la zona por ser una persona emprendedora y muy trabajadora. Sus condiciones habitacionales son muy humildes, su casa está hecha a base de lámina y actualmente la cubierta del techo de su vivienda se encuentra dañado a causa de las lluvias y el sol, además desea construir un muro que proteja el corredor de su vivienda. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales como lámina galvanizada, madera, arena, ladrillo y cemento para reparar el techo y construir el muro citado.
texts.en:
31-year old Jesús lives in his own house with his wife and children. He has run a store for eight years and is well known in the area as an enterprising and hardworking person. His home is a very simple one made of metal sheets, and right now the roof is damaged because of the rains and sun. He wishes to build a wall to protect the passageway of his house.

Jesús is seeking a loan to buy materials such as galvanized sheeting, wood, sand, bricks and cement to repair the roof and build the wall.

loans.use: Buy galvanized sheeting, wood, sand, bricks and cement to repair his roof and build a wall

loans.name: Synat

texts.en:
Synat is 32 years old and married with two children. She lives with her husband and children in Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province, where she operates a farming business, growing a variety of vegetables and rice to sell. She has been a farmer for since 2010 and earns approximately $10.00 per day. 

To help her further develop her farming business, Synat is borrowing a loan to buy a cow for maintenance at the rice fields and to buy a water pump, which will be used to carry the water into her vegetable fields. Synat will continue working in her business in order to boost income for her family and provide them a better quality of life.

loans.use: o buy a cow for maintenance at the rice fields and to buy a water pump, which will be used to carry the water into her vegetable fields.

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Savoeun, 45, is married with two children who are going to school. She currently lives with her family in a remote area of Santuk district in Kampong Thom province. She is an industrious farmer who has been working in the agricultural sector for nearly 20 years. She primarily grows rice crops to sell after harvest season. With her earnings from farming, Savoeun is able to provide food for her family and allowances for her school-age children.

Currently, Savoeun’s family has an unhygienic latrine for use, so it can’t provide her family healthful living conditions. That’s why she is asking for a loan to build a safe, hygienic latrine to promote their health. Thanks to the water loan program offered by HKL with a special rate. It has encouraged Savoeun to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and protect the environment.

loans.use: a loan to build a safe, hygienic latrine to promote their health.

loans.name: Mariel Fernanda

texts.es: La señora Mariel tiene 26 años y  2 hijos que son de las edades de 8 y 2 años, la señora Mariel  se dedica a la venta de distintos artículos como electrodomésticos, ella da los productos a crédito,   ella trae a pedido  desde la ciudad de Oruro semanalmente y los acomoda, ella vive en la zona de Sewencani, este préstamo es la primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la señora Mariel  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mercadería electrodomésticos al por mayor ya que estas fechas están muy requeridos. su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la cliente por la temporada de fin de año tiene que cambiar stock y mercadería,  la señora Mariel  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el tener que viajar para la compra de mercadería como también el tener que ir a cobrar a su clientela ya que en muchos casos no le pagan, va a utilizar los beneficios para tener un capital de trabajo para poder invertir y generar ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener una tienda de electrodomésticos donde pueda vender al por mayor y menor.
texts.en:
Mariel is 26 years old, and has 2 children who are 8 and 2 years old.  Mariel works selling various items such as household appliances, and she sells the products on credit.  She orders her inventory weekly from the City of Oruro.  She lives in the Sewencani zone.

This is her first cycle with the institution, and she intends to use the loan to purchase merchandise such as household appliances in bulk as they are in high demand during this time of year.  The reason why she is seeking this loan is since it is the end of the year, she needs to change her inventory.  Mariel faces challenges in her business such as the need to travel to purchase the merchandise, as well as having to go out to collect from her customers as in many cases, they do not pay her.  She will use the loan to increase her working capital to be able to invest in her business and generate revenues.  Her wish for her business is to have a household appliance store where she can sell in wholesale and retail.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as household appliances.

loans.name: Kheang

texts.en:
Kheang is a 29-year-old married woman. She has been blessed with two children, who completely depend on her income. To make a living, she runs her farm with the help of her husband. She primarily grows rice and cassavas to sell. Her husband, aside from helping her in farming activities, is also engaged in fishing in order to supplement to their income.

Kheang is requesting a loan to buy a cow for maintenance of the rice fields. She hopes to reduce the operating costs in renting others' animals and to yield better crops through the help of the loan. She is very delighted and thankful to all lenders.

loans.use: to buy a cow for maintenance of the rice fields.

loans.name: Thim

texts.en:
Thim is a resident from a rural village of Baray district, Kampong Thom province. He is 34 years old, and married. He has one child, who still depends on his income and is attending to school. Being a responsible father, who aims to provide better living conditions, Thim works as a farmer growing rice on his own farm and is also involved in trading natural medicine for additional income. 

In order to improve his income, Thim would like to invest in the purchase of 5,000 Kg of rice to stock for future sales. Due to insufficient capital, he is asking for a loan from HKL to make the investment. 

Thim is working tirelessly toward the attainment of his dream, which is to build and expand his farming business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of 5,000 Kg of rice to stock for future sales.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis hace dos años, revisó sus ahorros y se dio cuenta que además de invertir en la compra de su propia vivienda, le alcanzaban para emprender un negocio que le generara ingresos. Así fue como observando con un amigo el mercado, percibió la necesidad de ofrecer servicios de alquiler de máquinas para lavar que le facilitaran a las familias, especialmente a las mujeres de hogar sus tareas diarias. Hoy se siente muy satisfecho de haber tomado esta decisión y quiere hacer crecer su negocio. Sus ventas las realiza diariamente, ofreciendo el servicio desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Su meta es incrementar sus activos, para generar más ingresos y con ello continuar generando una mejor calidad de vida. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará lavadoras que le ayudes a lograr la meta de incremento de sus ventas generadoras de nuevos ingresos, sueño de prosperidad que poco a poco conseguirá.
texts.en:
Two years ago, Luis took a look at his savings and realized that, besides investing in the purchase of his own home, he had enough to undertake a business to generate income.  So it happened that while watching a friend in the market, he realized the need to offer washing machine rentals to help families, especially housewives, with their daily chores.  These days he feels very pleased that he made that decision and wants to expand his business.

He makes his sales daily, offering his services from 8 in the morning until 8 at night.  His goal is to increase his inventory in order to generate more income and, with that, to continue creating a better quality of life.  Now he is applying for a Kiva loan, with which he will buy washing machines to help him reach his goal of increasing his income-generating rentals: a dream of prosperity that he will reach little by little.

loans.use: to buy washing machines to rent out.

loans.name: Mshimba

texts.en: Mshimba is an industrious man who is making ends meet by doing farming. His previous loan helped him to buy pesticides for his business, and here again he comes to you requesting another loan of 50,000 KES to buy various seeds for planting during this season. He appreciates the support from Kiva and Yehu at large.

loans.use: to buy various seeds for planting during this season.

loans.name: Ndoro

texts.en:
Ndoro is asking for a loan because he believes that through it, he will improve his business.

The previous loan enabled him to save money from his goat meat-selling business. He is requesting a loan of KES 10,000 to purchase goats for his business.

He feels that he was able to make a good investment with his previous loan, which to date has allowed him to maintain his level of profits to help his family cover their personal expenses.

loans.use: to purchase goats for his business.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is 23 years old, married to Irene and supports a family of two. He runs a butcher shop in Kapsabet. This has been his income-generating business for the last seven years, and he earns an average monthly income of 110,000 KES. 

He has borrowed a loan of 90,000 KES, and this is his second loan after paying the previous loan successfully. He plans to use the loan to purchase animals for slaughter and to sell the meat. 

He will use the profits from the business to repay the loan, save for his children’s school fees and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase animals for slaughter.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is married with two children who currently attend school. Her husband works abroad. 

Sharon’s first businesses were raising hogs and operating a junk shop. But, when she became tired of running these businesses, she decided to open her retail store.

Meanwhile, she received a small remittance from her husband working abroad. With regards to their situation, she decided to seek a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy grocery items such as noodles, toothpaste, shampoo, soap and conditioner to sell in her store.

She believes that this loan will enable her to earn higher income that will help her in sustaining her family needs.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as noodles, toothpaste, shampoo, soap and conditioner to sell

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 41 years old and married with five children. 

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Margie has been farming sugarcane for four years and she also earns additional income from retailing rice in a general store. 

Margie is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman who has been blessed with kids who attend school. For the past two years, she has raised and sold poultry. Margaret lives in her own house with electricity and running water and her greatest monthly expense is school fees. Her greatest business challenge is disease outbreaks. Margaret joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Margaret is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase chicks and poultry feed. In the future, she dreams of becoming a poultry wholesaler.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Nyanje

texts.en:
Nyanje runs a business selling goat meat. He used a previous loan to increase his business income and save money. Nyanje’s loan allowed him to maintain his profits and help his family meet their personal expenses.

Nyanje is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to purchase more goats for his business. He believes his loan will improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase goats

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a mother of four children. For years, she has operated a food-selling business, selling from home to neighbors and passersby. Mary lives with her family in their own house without electricity or running water. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Mary is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar for her business. In the future, she dreams of establishing a big shop.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar

loans.name: Piru

texts.en:
Piru is a very hardworking and enterprising man who says that he has been able to greatly increase his income and help his family, thanks to his hard work.

He is asking for a loan to buy more gallons of petrol for resale.He joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of petrol for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bitter ball to sell

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a hardworking and enterprising woman who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past two years, she has operated a food stall business, preparing various foods such as rice, flat bread, and beans, and selling them to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. 

With the KES 5,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, rice, beans, and cooking  oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, rice, beans, and cooking  oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice and general stock for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more peanuts for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more shirts, jeans and other items for resale

loans.name: Evi

texts.en:
Evi lives in Bogor, a suburban area located about an hour from Jakarta. Evi and four other family members live together in the family house. Evi is an entrepreneur who runs a small stall that sells soft drinks, snacks, cell phone accessories, and mobile phone airtime credits. She joined Ruma because she was interested in expanding her business. Previously, she took a working capital loan from Kiva and she already paid it back on time. 

Evi is taking another loan from Kiva because she sees sales opportunities on weekends as more customers come to her small shop to buy mobile phone airtime credits. Over the last months, she has been able to process around 3-4% higher sales volume on weekends than on weekdays. Evi hopes that she can improve the small stall that she runs and put aside the extra cash for her family savings. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and a weighing scale

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 24 years old and her husband Bishu is 28 years old. Anna, Bishu and their three children (one son and two daughters) live in a kachha house (made of straw, mud and bamboo) in the small village of Raipara in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri. Both Anna and her husband are uneducated and can only sign their names. All their children are receiving education and they are in grades 2,  5 and 6 respectively.

Anna's husband is a farmer.  He grows seasonable vegetables in their own land and sells them in the local market.  He is the only source of income for the family.  Anna also helps her husband in his agricultural work, after managing her household work.  Their economic condition is not running smoothly because her household expenses are gradually increasing day by day, specially the educational expenses of her children.  Both Anna and her husband are struggling to cover their family's basic needs.

Accordingly, Anna and her husband have decided to start potato cultivation on their farmland. She has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers. They will grow potatoes and after the harvest, they will sell them at the market. Anna knows that economic development is needed for a family so she is working hard to give support to her family.  She dreams of giving her children good education and building a pacca house (brick and concrete-made) with the profit generated from the business.

Anna is very much thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase good quality potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivating potatoes.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
