Kalsoom is 46 years old and married. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is requesting a loan for her husband’s fruit selling business. He sells seasonal fruit from a donkey cart. He wants to buy oranges in large quantities to sell because they are in season and the prices are very low.
 
Kalsoom hopes that this loan will prove productive for her and she will save a reasonable amount to meet household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase oranges

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale

loans.name: Madhubala

texts.en:
Madhubala is a young entrepreneur who is married and has two children (one son and one daughter).  She is 37 years old.  She is married to Profulla, who is a cycle-van puller.  Both the husband and wife are illiterate and can only sign their names. Their daughter got married and their son is engaged in a ply business. They live in the small village Barosoria in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri in their own house.

Madhubala's husband earns for the family by carrying goods and people on his cycle-van.  His income is too small to maintain all the necessities of their family.  Madhubala and her son are engaged in a business of supplying ply in different plywood shops and wood factories. Ply is a layer of a folded or laminated material used in making plywood and wood furniture. They collect ply from their village and neighboring villages and supply it to different carpenters' shops and to the traders of wood.  They decided to expand their business by purchasing more raw materials. For that they need some capital.  

Madhubala has taken a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to purchase more ply to be able to supply more. The loan will help her work become more effective and efficient and therefore improve her services, which will continue to help her family and give them everything they need.

Madhubala hopes to generate more income and secure a better life from this business. She wants to purchase a mini truck in future to carry their goods to the market.

She appreciates and thanks her lenders BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase ply for the plywood business.

loans.name: Alpana

texts.en:
Alpana is 33 years old, married and raising one son, together with her husband Benu, 49 years old. They are from the small village of Magurmari in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri. They have a small kachha house (made of mud, straw and bamboo).  Both Alpana and her husband have primary education.  Their only son is a student in grade 8.

Alpana's husband is engaged in a small business and earns little, not enough to support the whole family.  He is the main source of income for the family, so Alpana has decided to start up a milk supply business and dairy products (milk, butter, paneer, curd, cheese etc.) business to help his husband to run the family well. She chose Kiva’s partner, BJS, for this loan as she wants to purchase a cow and she heard that they fund dairy farmers.  She hopes to earn a good profit from this business as there is a great demand for dairy products in her locality and in the present market.  She is also hopeful that with her efforts and dedication, she will improve her family's living conditions.

With the goal of starting the business, she has taken a loan from BJS to purchase a dairy cow.  She plans to use the income to further increase her business, as well as to save money for her son's education, and upgrade their kachha house to a pacca one( brick and concrete made).

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow and start up a milk supply and dairy products business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and a weighing scale

loans.name: Blanca Lorena

texts.es: Blanca de 36 años de edad  vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos y su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa interior para damas, caballeros y niños, vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias y mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela pues sus productos son de muy buena calidad y a buen precio con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, blanca esta solicitando un crédito para la  comprar de mas ropa interior por mayor y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Blanca is 36 years old, and lives with her four children and husband in a house that she owns.  She works selling underwear for women, men and children.  She is a traveling saleswoman and sells in the different villages and markets near her home.  She has a large customer base because her products are high quality and low-priced.  With the earnings from her sales and the help of her husband, they are able to cover their household expenses.  

Blanca is seeking a loan to purchase underwear in bulk  in order to increase her revenues so she can give her family a better quality of life with out any limitations.

loans.use: purchase more underwear in bulk for women, men and children.

loans.name: Mulimuli

texts.en:
Mulimuli is 30 years old and married with four children. She makes and sells fans, handbags, bangles and other items to earn a living. To earn extra income, she also has a taro and banana plantation and has been doing this for three years.

Mulimuli has requested a loan to buy fabric paint, pandanus leaves, materials and a sewing machine, and also chemicals and fertilizer.

She plans to use her profits to extend her business. She joined SPBD in 2006 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabric paint, pandanus leaves, materials and a sewing machine, and also chemicals and fertilizer.

loans.name: Latea

texts.en: Latea is a 55-year-old woman who is married with 10 children. She runs a business selling tin fish, milk, sugar, salt, etc. in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. Latea has requested a loan to buy milk, toilet paper, sugar, salt, mosquito coils, laundry soaps, laundry powder, snacks, cigarettes and soft drinks. She plans to use her profits to provide financial support for her family and kids. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy milk, toilet paper, sugar, salt, mosquito coils, laundry soaps, laundry powder, snacks, cigarettes and soft drinks.

loans.name: Faalagi

texts.en:
Faalagi is a 22-year-old woman and is married with no children. 

She has a small garden where she grows taro, cabbages, cucumber and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years.

Faalagi needs a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, axe, spade, chemicals and bush knives. Faalagi will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy wheelbarrow, axe, spade, chemicals and bush knives

loans.name: Lepetia

texts.en:
Lepetia is a 51-year-old married woman with six children.

She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas, yams and taamu to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years.

Lepetia has requested a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, chemicals, fertilizer, a crowbar, bush knives, a file, boots and a spade.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2007. With her profits, Lepetia hopes to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, chemicals, fertilizer, a crowbar, bushknives, a file, boots and a spade

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is aged 44 and blessed with five children. She is working hard so that she can provide the needs of her family. 

She is engaged in a rice retailing business in their village. Her wish is to improve her business and make it more profitable.

She is now borrowing 10,000 PHP to purchase more sacks of grain and rice to resell.

She's hoping that her business will become more successful so that she can improve their status of living.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of grain and rice to resell

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is from Nyandarua South. He is 41 years old and married with three children who are between the ages of 2 and 12 years.

Elijah has a farming business that he has been doing for many years and has applied for his sixth loan which he intends to use to buy some mobile accessories to boost his secondary business. He is running a mobile business alongside farming. 

Elijah hopes to expand his business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy mobile accessories.

loans.name: Monchita

texts.en:
Monchita is 71 years old and widowed with six children. Monchita works very hard to provide for them.

Monchita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, toothpaste, coffee, sugar, noodles, bread, etc., to sell.

Monchita has been in this business for 51 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, toothpaste, coffee, sugar, noodles, bread, etc. 

Monchita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, toothpaste, coffee, sugar, noodles, bread, etc., to sell

loans.name: Roxana Yaneth

texts.es:
Roxana de 18 años de edad, estudio solamente hasta noveno grado, dado a que se acompaño y no pudo seguir estudiando y decidió mejor poner un negocio. Esta acompañada, su pareja es vendedor de dulces, no tiene hijos y  viven con su mamá y una hermana. 


Ella tiene una venta de tostadas, yuca frita y enrredos en el patio de su casa , su mamá anteriormente se dedicaba a lo mismo y ella le ayudaba;  así es que desde muy pequeña hace este negocio  y no tiendo un estudio superior para poder trabajar se decidió por el negocio que actualmente desempeña, no tiene nada mas que esta actividad,  su horario de trabajo es de 2:00 p.m.  hasta las 6:00 p.m. 4 veces  a la semana.


Roxana ademas de lo que ya tiene, quiera hacer pupusas y el dinero del préstamo lo ocupara para comprar una plancha y comprar los materiales para la venta y hacer una galerita, pues teniendo un negocio mas fuerte y mas productivo aumentara sus ingresos y  mejorara su calidad de vida.


Los sueños de Roxana, es poder seguir estudiando y  hacer crecer su negocio junto con su familia, ella espera darle un futuro mejor a los hijos  que tenga y tener ella un futuro mejor y el préstamo le ayudara financieramente a lograrlo; las ganancias le ayudaran a ampliar el negocio y por medio de mucho trabajo y esfuerzo lo lograra.
texts.en:
Roxana, 18, left school after the ninth grade.  Already paired with a boyfriend then and unable to go on studying, she decided to start a business instead of moving on in school.  Her partner makes a living selling snacks.  She has no children and lives with her mother and a sister.


Roxana operates a food business, selling tostadas, fried yucca and enredos.  She works from her house and picked up the business from her mother who operated the business before.  She had always helped her mother so taking over the business made sense once she decided not to continue in school.  She has no other income and works this business from 2:00pm to 6:00pm, 4 days a week.


Roxana wants to add more dishes--specifically, pupusas--to her menu and she will use this loan to buy a press and the other supplies she needs to improve her small kitchen.  The investment will help her to build up the business and, in turn, increase her income.


For the future, Roxana would like to go back to school.  She also wants to continue building her business so that she can provide for any children she might have.  This loan will help her to meet her goals.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food sales business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Victor's Group

texts.en:
Victor is a member of Amuka Group in Busia District.  He is pictured here in a group of 5 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 39 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Victor has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving funds for ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 Kenyan shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.
							
Victor is 62 years old and has been a farmer for 42 years.  Victor works as a farmer to provide for his 9 children.  The community and other farmers know Victor as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy and an experienced farmer.  Other than farming, he is also involved in his community activities such as the men's group and prayer group.  Victor described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.

Victor joined One Acre Fund in 2013, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  Victor joined One Acre Fund so that he could get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and earn enough to feed his family.  Because he likes being a leader, and he is an active community member, he wants to help more farmers. Victor has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative.  Working with One Acre Fund has improved Victor's life because he has more profits from harvest, has more farm training and has more farm group support.  In the future, Victor hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to repair the home, save for the future and invest in a business.

Victor and the Amuka Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to allow farmers the opportunity to buy cost-efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds

loans.name: Maria Josefina

texts.es:
María, es madre soltera, vive junto a sus hijos y una hermana, sus amistades la motivaron a adquirir una moto taxi, la cual paga quien la maneje, hoy en día cuenta con  dos unidades, también tiene venta de repuestos para moto taxis, 
Comprará diferentes repuestos y terminara de pagar una de las moto taxi, le permitirá fortalecer el negocio de una forma rápida y así ofrecerá un mejor servicio a sus clientes, espera mejorara su economía para continuar dando a sus hijos una vida familiar más confortable.
María sueña con tener un negocio fortalecido y cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en:
María is a single mother who lives with her children and one sister.  Her friends motivated her to purchase a motorcycle taxi, that the drivers pay her to use.  Today, she has two motorcycles, and she also sells replacement parts for motorcycles. 

She will purchase replacement parts and finishing paying for one of her motorcycles.  This will allow her to fortify her business quickly and offer better service to her customers.  She hopes to improve her finances so she can continue to provide her children with a more comfortable living situation.  María dreams of having a strong business and paying off her debts.

loans.use: purchase different parts and finish paying for one of her motorcycle taxis.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is married and has children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a poultry business, selling eggs and chicks at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase chicken feed and medicine for the chicks in her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicken feed and medicine for the chicks in her business.

loans.name: Yain Kaain

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Yain Kain from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 2 children. Her children are currently attending school. After her wedding, Yain Kain established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to create income to get her daily bread. She works at the business 10 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that at present her business is doing well.

Yain Kain requires a loan in order to purchase more plates, cups, and a variety of food containers. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and increase her business. In the future she plans to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase more plates, cups, and a variety of food containers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, etc., in other to have her business turn into a bigger one.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Virgen De Natividad I Group

texts.es:
La socia Gabriela  continua perteneciendo al banco comunal VIRGEN DE NATIVIDAD I,la socia Gabriela tiene 42 años de edad es soltera y tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna sus  actividades diarias con el negocio de salón de belleza, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada di a su negocio ,la socia realiza diferentes tipos de cortes y teñidos de caballo a sus clientes que le solicitan ,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de tientes, tijeras entre otros.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de crianza de animales menores, venta de chicha de jora, venta de plásticos, venta de pasto, trabajador en construcción.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member, Gabriela continues to be a part of the Virgen de Natividad I communal bank.  Gabriela is a 42 year old single mother of two.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her beauty salon business.  She has worked in this business for a long time, and it has gone well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day.  She does different types of hair cuts and coloring for her clients.  She is a responsible and hardworking woman.  She hopes to continue working so she can continue to support her family.

The member is seeking this loan to purchase hair coloring supplies, scissors, and other supplies. 

The members who appear in the appended picture asked for permission to come to the meeting late due to work responsibilities.  The other members dedicate their time to raising animals, selling corn liquor, selling plastic, selling hay and working in construction.  The members is grateful for the loan and is committed to complying with the established payments.

loans.use: purchase hair coloring supplies, scissors, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

Mary Jane requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like flour, spices, etc.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like flour, spices, etc.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more ready-to-wear products needed for her business. The loan was helpful not just in her business but also in the education of her children. Her accessory business was also helped by the loan that she acquired. Her income from her business assists in her everyday household expenditures. She and her husband work hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Susan would like to apply for another 60,000 PHP loan to buy additional stock of ready-to-wear products and merchandise items, like polo shirts for men and women, socks, and shirts, in order to expand her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. Having more items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to meet her family's daily needs and pay for her children's educational expenses. Susan looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Susan hopes to have more products to sell so that her business will grow bigger. She dreams that her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ready-to-wear products and merchandise, like polo shirts, socks, and shirts to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Ronalyn

texts.en:
A loan of PHP 7,000 is offered to Ronalyn to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy products every day. She will buy some additional supplies, such as noodles, fish, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, bread and shampoo, with the loan. 

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels comfortable managing her business because she can earn money every day. Running a retailing business was very difficult to handle, but with her determination to become responsible enough, she believes that she works out her business to improve more and earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy some additional supplies, such as noodles, fish, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, bread and shampoo, to sell.

loans.name: Bintiomari

texts.en: Bintiomari appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She would like to apply for a loan of 5,000 KES to buy more stock of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice and vegetables for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household consumables , wheat flour, maize flour, rice and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, Maggi cubes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks, and soap to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and a weighing scale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing material to sell.

loans.name: Akhtar

texts.en:
Akhtar is a 47-year-old lady. She lives with her husband and five children. She is taking a loan for her daughters because all of her daughters are experts in the art of embroidery. They are very expert in their professions and knit very fine bridal dresses. 

Due to demand, they are facing a shortage of material, which means they are unable to create their fine embroidery. Therefore, Akhtar requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so she can buy raw materials for embroidery. With this loan, she will buy threads, fancy cloth, precious stones, sequins, and pearls in various colors. Akhtar is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for embroidery.

loans.name: Eladio

texts.es:
Eladio, es una persona que vive junto a su esposa y uno de sus hijos, en sus inicios fue empleado de una panadería, luego tomo cursos relacionados con la elaboración de pan, ya con mucha experiencia hace 15 años instalo su propia panadería, cuanta con 12 empleados que le ayudan salir con sus pedidos.
Con el crédito comprará azúcar, harina, levadura y mejorara la infraestructura de su local, con lo que espera mejorar la imagen del negocio, dar mejores condiciones de trabajo a sus empleados, aumentar su producción, seguir ofreciendo una fuente de empleo a sus empleados incrementar sus ventas y establecerse económicamente.
Sueña con fortalecer su negocio para tener los ingresos necesarios con los que cancelara su deuda, mejorara la alimentación, salud y vestuario de su familia.
texts.en:
Eladio and his wife have one child at home.  He went to work for a bakery many years ago, took classes to learn to make bread and then opened his own bakery.  He has operated the business for 15 years now and has 12 employees.  
Eladio will use part of this loan to buy the supplies he needs for baking--sugar, flour, yeast, etc.--and the rest to improve his workspace so that he and his employees have a better environment to work.  The investment will help him increase production and continue providing a means of employment for his workers.
For the future, Eladio wants to build his business further and generate an income that will allow him to pay past debts and better provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his bakery business and pay for improvements to his workspace.

loans.name: Josue Daniel

texts.es: Josue de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su madre, el se dedica  a la venta de zapatos su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado en un lugar muy estratégico donde circulan muchas personas por esa razón posee mucha clientela que lo prefieren por la calidad de sus productos y los buenos precios, Josue esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas zapatos por mayor y asi poder surtir su negocio para atender mejor a sus clientes y generar mejores ganancias para tener junto a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Josue is 32 years old and lives in a home of his own with his wife and mother.  He sells shoes from a strategically located spot in the market where many people gather.  This is why he has many customers who prefer to buy from him because of the quality of his products and the good prices.  Josue is asking for a loan to buy more shoes in quantity and be able to stock his business, serve more customers and generate more income so he and his family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy shoes in quantity.

loans.name: Maria Mirian

texts.es: maria de 63 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, ella se dedica a la venta de tamales y pupusas es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable siempre esta en busca de poder sacar adelante a su familia, ahora ella quiere mejorar su vivienda quiere colocar piso cerámico para poder tener mas limpia su casa, pero con lo que gana de sus ventas no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, por esa razon solicita un credito para la compra de cerámica, cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra para poder realizar lo antes mencionado.
texts.en:
María is a 63-year old woman who lives in her own house with her family. She makes a living selling "tamales" (pasties made of corn) and "pupusas" (stuffed tortillas). She is very hardworking and responsible, and is always looking to provide for her family. 

She now wants to make improvements to her house and put ceramic floors that will keep the house cleaner. However, given that her income is not enough to cover the expenses that this would entail, she is requesting a loan to buy ceramic, cement and sand, and to cover labor costs.

loans.use: to buy ceramic, cement and sand, and to cover labor costs.

loans.name: Sr. De Huanca De Coya Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SR DE HUANCA DE COYA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Coya, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Graciela ella es casada y tiene 48 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 10:00 p.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo,carne y verduras.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de agricultura, negocio de venta de tejidos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Sr. de Huanca de Coya communal bank.  This bank is located in the Coya district, Calca province, Cusco department.

Graciela, a member, is 48 years old.  She is married and has three children.  She works in her restaurant business.  She prepares different dishes like chicken with potatoes, soups, and ‘saltado de carne’ [a stir-fried Peruvian dish of meats and vegetables].  She works from 10:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.  She has had this business for seven years, and it is going very well for her.  Her dream is to expand her restaurant business.

She is requesting the loan to buy products for cooking.  She will buy things like chicken, meat, and vegetables.

The other members devote themselves to the businesses of farming, selling woven goods, grocery store, and selling animals.

Graciela is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this means.  She pledges to make her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy products like chicken, meat, and vegetables for cooking.

loans.name: Mangale

texts.en:
Mangale is a hardworking and enterprising man who lives at the Coastal region of Kenya.He lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

For the past two years, he has been selling goats at the market to the general public. The main challenge for his business has been unstable market prices. 

He joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds.  He is requesting a loan of  20,000 KES to purchase more goats.

loans.use: to purchase more goats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rubber dishes (plates, bowls, cups, tubs, etc) for her business.

loans.name: La Cruz De Yerbateros Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 9  socios   responsables a distintas actividades comerciales. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “LA CRUZ DE YERBATEROS ” una de ellas es milagros  de 26 años conviviente con su pareja  y con 1  hijo,  milagros   se dedica ya hace 1  año a la venta de calzado(zapatillas)   tanto para damas como para caballeros  en un pequeño local  todos los días con el merito de salir adelante y tener un ingreso mas ,  Con el fruto de su esfuerzo milagros   ha logrado mejorar su  vivienda   y  también  Seguir mejorando en su  negocio,  Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más calzados  y así poder tener más ingresos. A la vez  milagros se encuentra sentada se le distingue con su chompa de color plomo,  se despide con un abraso a Kiva y Edaprospo y  agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso
texts.en: The "LA CRUZ DE YERBATEROS" community bank has 9 members who operate small businesses of various kinds.  Milagros, 26, is one of the bank's members.  She and her partner have 1 child.  Milagros has operated a shoes (sneakers) sales business for 1 year.  She operates the business in a small shop and sells shoes for both men and women.  She works hard to generate the extra income her family needs and has used her earnings to make improvements to both her business and her house.  Milagros will use this loan to stock her shoes sales business so that she can continue to build her business and provide for her family.  In the photo, Milagros is sitting at the table, wearing a gray sweatshirt.  She asked that we send her thanks and good wishes to Kiva lenders and Edaprospo for extending this loan and helping her to get ahead.

loans.use: to stock her shoes sales business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add stock of vegetables

loans.name: Nha Yen Melissa

texts.es: La Señorita Melissa tiene 20 años y es soltera,  estudia la carrera  de licenciatura en economía en una universidad muy reconocida de la ciudad de La Paz, la Señorita Melissa trabaja  para pagar sus estudios trabaja vendiendo productos de belleza de una línea muy conocida a nivel mundial,  la Señorita Melissa va a usar este préstamo para  distintos gastos  que implica el estudiar como pago de matrícula,  compra de una  material de escritorio para sus estudios que durara el tiempo cinco años,  la Señorita Melissa enfrenta retos en su estudios que son falta de apoyo económico  por parte de sus padres y el tener que trabajar y estudiar es muy duro pero ella tiene ganas de seguir adelante superarse terminar su carrera y poder ejercer su profesión,  viven en la zona de Zongo, su deseo es poder terminar sus estudios y poder encontrar trabajo para ejercer su profesión y con el tiempo poder estudiar una maestría.
texts.en:
Melissa, age 20, is single.  She is studying for a degree in economics at a very well-known university in the city of La Paz.  Melissa works in order to pay for her studies.  She works by selling beauty products from a line that is very well-known on a worldwide level.

Melissa is going to use this loan for different educational expenses.  She will pay tuition, and she will buy desk supplies for her studies that will last for five years.

Melissa faces challenges in her studies.  They are the lack of financial support from her parents and having to work and study.  It is very hard for her. However, she has the desire to get ahead and succeed by completing her degree and being able to practice her profession.

They live in the Zongo area.  Her wish is to be able to finish her studies and be able to find work in order to practice her profession.  In time, she wants to be able to study for her master’s degree.

loans.use: to pay for educational expenses; tuition, materials, and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more paracetamol, quinine, wrong tables, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and a weighing scale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks, and soap to expand her business.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan, solicita capital para invertir en surtir el inventario de su tienda, debido a que estas fiestas de fin de año son muy favorables para aumentar sus ventas. Comprará bebidas, golosinas, paletas, arroz, maíz, etc., con lo que podrá seguir cumpliendo con las demandas de sus clientes.
Con el crédito anterior compro la mercadería necesaria para fortalecer el negocio, aumentar sus ventas, su economía ha mejorado notablemente, ha podido cancelar sus cuotas y las condiciones familiares son mejores.
texts.en: Juan is applying for a loan that he will use to stock his corner grocery.  The holidays are coming and he wants to be ready to meet the demand he expects.  He will use the loan to buy drinks, snacks and other merchandise that his customers will come to him to buy.  He used past loans to buy the merchandise that he needed to build up the business and increase sales.  His finances have notably improved and he's been able to both pay off the loans and better provide for his family.

loans.use: to stock his corner grocery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to tend to and protect her coffee crops.

loans.name: Nolberto

texts.es:
Nolberto tiene 53 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y su menor hijo, en el Centro Poblado El Cumbe, una zona rural del distrito de Callayuc, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Cutervo, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, su cultivo es principalmente el café, esta actividad lo realiza desde hace 10 años , es un padre emprendedor, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de de abonos para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos y de esta manera tener una mejor producción de café para ofrecer a un mejor precio a sus clientes de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Nolberto, age 53, lives with his wife and child in the village of El Cumbe.  It is a rural area in the Callayuc district.  The population devotes itself to farming, commerce, and livestock.  It is two hours from the city of Cutervo in the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru.

He is a farmer, and his main crop is coffee.  He has been engaged in this business activity for ten years.  He is an enterprising father.

He has requested a loan for 3,000 soles to buy fertilizers to perform maintenance on his crops.  This way he will have a better coffee production to offer at a better price to his customers.  This way he will generate greater income for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to perform maintenance on his coffee crops.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is a Kiva borrower. She has one child. She describes herself as being experienced. 

Everline operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 27 years. Her business is located in a viable place and her primary customers are local customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stocks of cereals. Her business goal is to have a sustainable business within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will have a successful future. 

This is Everline's first loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM).

loans.use: to add stocks of cereals to her business.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her, as she was able to buy more grocery items for her variety store. Her loan is also helpful in the education of her children. Her income from business, on the other hand, is assisting with their everyday expenses at home. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for 14,000 PHP, to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Emelia dreams that her business will be more flourishing and hopes to have a better living. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, products and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Mwaboso

texts.en: Mwaboso's previous loan enabled him to expand his business, earn a higher income, and improve his living standards. He is requesting another loan from Yehu for 10,000 KES, which he will use to purchase spare parts and renovate his motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and renovate his motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, so she can improve the kitchen in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a smartphone, asolar charging set, and aweighing scale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothing materials for males and females to expand his business.

loans.name: Aiash

texts.en:
Aiash is a 20-year-old, single man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is very hard-working and he has been operating a grocery store. He started his business with a small capital providing by his father to establish a grocery store.  He has regular customers because he brings in fresh products. He has employed two workers who help him in his business.

He has made the decision to invest in his business by buying merchandise wholesale so that he can have the store well-stocked with a variety of products that will help him to keep his clientele and to attract new customers, so he is requesting a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy grocery products that will increase his profit. In the future, he hopes to attain better living conditions in order to get married.

loans.use: to buy grocery products to increase his profit.

loans.name: Feiloaiga

texts.en: Feiloaiga is 51 years old and is married with 2 children. She has a small garden where she grows taros, bananas and vegetables that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 4 years. Feiloaiga needs a loan to buy vegetable seeds, a rake, chemicals, fertilizer, a backpack sprayer, a garden hose, a crowbar and barbed wire. Feiloaiga has been a member of SPBD since 2010.  She will use the profits from her sales to improve her family's living and help her kids' education.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, a rake, chemicals, fertilizer, a backpack sprayer, a garden hose, a crowbar and barbed wire.

loans.name: Solialofi

texts.en: Solialofi is 39 years old and is married with 3 children. She has a small garden where she grows eggplant, taros, bananas and yams that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. Solialofi needs a loan to buy fertilizer, weed killers, boots, a rake, a crowbar, a digging stick, barbed wire and a backpack sprayer. She joined  SPBD in 2013. Solialofi will use the profits from her sales to support her family and to send her kids to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, weed killers, boots, a rake, a crowbar, a digging stick, barbed wire and a backpack sprayer.

loans.name: Maurin Cris

texts.en: Maurin Cris is 22 years old and is married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them. Maurin Cris runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like soft drinks, sugar and milk to sell. Maurin Cris has been in this business for one year. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like soft drinks, sugar and milk to sell.

loans.name: Ingrid Indira

texts.es:
Indrid, se decidió por otro crédito para comprar variedad de ropa, con estilos, colores, y tallas diferentes tanto para damas como para caballeros, ya que se está preparando para las fechas navideñas que es cuando más demanda de sus clientes tiene.
Con el préstamo anterior surtió el inventario de su venta de ropa, logro la satisfacción de sus clientes, sus ventas han aumentado, su condición económica mejoró, y su familia se encuentra muy saludable siempre apoyándola para salir  adelante.
texts.en:
Ingrid decided to seek another loan in order to buy clothing of various styles, colors, and sizes for women and men.  She is preparing for the Christmas holidays when there is a lot of demand from her customers.

With her previous loan she bought clothing for sale and satisfied her customer's needs.  Her sales have increased and her economic situation improved.  Her family is healthy and they always support her as she struggles to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing.

loans.name: Elena Del Carmen

texts.es:
Elena, es madre de dos hijos con edades 12 y 13, es casada, con el fin de ayudar con los gastos de su hogar, desde hace 10 años tiene una sala de belleza, la atiende todos los días, de 6:00 a.m. hasta 7:00 p.m.,  a la fecha no ha tenido problema en administrar su negocio.
Invertirá en la compra de tintes, cremas y maquillajes, para fortalecer su negocio y dar mejor servicio a sus clientes. Espera tener mejores ingresos para cumplir con sus compromisos económicos.
Sueña con mantener activo su negocio y contar por los recursos para darle a sus hijos una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Elena is the mother of two children, ages 12 and 13. She is married, with the goal of helping with the expenses of her home. For the past ten years, she's had a beauty salon. She tends to it every day, from 6 AM to 7 PM. To date, she has not had problems in running her business.

She will invest in the purchase of dyes, creams and makeup, to strengthen her business and give better service to her clients. She hopes to have better income to meet her economic obligations.

She dreams of keeping her business active and counting on the resources to give a university career to her children.

loans.use: to buy dyes, creams and makeup.

loans.name: Mwaruwa

texts.en:
Mwaruwa is married and has nine children, all of whom attend school. For the past year, he has operated a food stall, selling to his neighbors and passersby. Seasonality and price fluctuation are his major challenges. 

Mwaruwa is requesting a loan from Yehu for 30,000 KES, which he will use he wants to purchase sugar, wheat flour, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans,  and cooking  oil. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business. Mwaruwa owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, wheat flour, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans,  and cooking  oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy thread, flour, oil, propane, cheese, fried pork rinds, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Ngala

texts.en:
Ngala is a hardworking and enterprising man who lives in the Coastal region of Kenya.

He has operated a fish-selling business for the last three years, selling at the market to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. 

With the KSHS 15,000, he wants to purchase fish, cooking oil, and firewood for his business. He decided to join Yehu to acquire financial services for his business

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil, and firewood

loans.name: Ahima

texts.en:
Ahima is a 54-year-old woman who lives in Ghalaigram in Dhupguri. She is married to Nutfar. She has been blessed with five children. Both Ahima and her husband are illiterate, but  know how to sign their names. Unfortunately they are not capable of providing education to their children as their income is so small. All of them are involved in the business of animal husbandry. 

Ahima is a housewife and her husband has been working in their own animal husbandry for many years, selling different animals in the market. They rear different animals especially cows and sell them to the market and in meat shops. They work hard throughout the day but still their income is very inconsistent. Ahima is not able to generate sufficient income to meet her family’s daily expenses, so that her children are also concerned to help their family financially. 

Now Ahima has heard about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and took out a loan to purchase a cow for her animal husbandry. She wants to build a large husbandry business with many animals. In the future she wants to be a good entrepreneur and wants to attain a stable income in life. She is very much thankful to BJS and Kiva because in her bad days, BJS came forward to help her and she has seen the light of success to make her dreams come true.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for her animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Kalpana is a 49-year-old housewife from a small village in Dhupguri. She lost her husband a few years back and now lives alone with her two children. She is illiterate and only knows how to sign her name, but very much willing to send her children to school. Unfortunately she is unable to send her children to school due to extreme poverty. She has to send her children to work to bear the family expenses. The children are the only wage-earners of her family, having engaged themselves in mason's work. 

Kalpana is a homemaker and it is next to impossible for her to fulfill the family’s basic needs with her children’s weekly income. She has her own land for farming, so she plans to take out a loan to start her new business of potato cultivation. She applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase potato seeds, fertilizers, urea and more for farming potatoes in her own land. Kalpana, being enterprising and tenacious, decided to grow potatoes as potatoes are a year-round crop as well as a very popular vegetable for most of Indian dishes. 

Kalpana is confident that she can earn a good profit through her new business which will enable her to generate sufficient income to give financial support to her children. She hopes that she could be able to build a pakka (concrete) house with the profit from her potato business and can improve her financial conditions to run her family smoothly. It becomes possible for her to start the new potato business only because of BJS and Kiva, so she is highly obliged to the lenders for funding the loan.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds, fertilizers, urea, etc. for potato cultivation.

loans.name: Krishna

texts.en:
Krishna is 24 years old and is married to Jaydev in the small village of Dhupguri. They have three daughters. Two of them go to school. One of them is still too small to go to school. Krishna and her husband are illiterate and can sign their names only. Krishna is a housewife and Jaydev is a farmer. He has been involved in farming for many years, selling different kinds of vegetables in the village market. At present Krishna is unable to earn a profit from her husband’s farming business. The income of her husband is insufficient to cover household expenses, so she decided to give support to her husband financially. 

Krishna plans to take a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase good quality potato seeds and fertilizers to farm potatoes along with other vegetables in her own farmland. She would like to extend her business and needs more laborers to assist her husband in farming. With the support of BJS and Kiva, Krishna is certain that she will be able to improve her business which will ultimately help her in earning more profit.

 If she is successful in earning a lot of profit from her potato cultivation, then Krishna wishes to build a concrete house rather living uncomfortably in a semi-pakka (concrete walls and thatched roof) house. Kalpana expressed great thanks to BJS and Kiva for their kind support which inspires her to start potato cultivation.

loans.use: To purchase good quality potato seeds and fertilizers for farming potatoes in her own farmland.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en: Serah is a 51-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 12 to 21 years. She describes herself to be industrious. She operates a retail business where she sells second hand goods like furniture, electronics etc. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a place with much potential and her primary customers are regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the slow movement of goods. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add to her stock of furniture, electronics and other second hand goods for resale. Her business goal is to open a new store within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will sustain her business and family. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy furniture, electronics and other second hand goods for resale

loans.name: In-2013-750 Group

texts.es: Dúo Señoras de los ajvix, este grupo formado por la señora Maria Pilar de 40 años de edad tiene 7 hijos, y se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles de primera nececidad como Frijol,Arroz,Aceite,jabon, etc.  se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace 5 años gracias a Dios le ha ido bien en su negocio, ella ya ha trabajado un credito con Kiva y no cayo en mora, es una persona luchadoras con ganas de superarse cada dia mas, en esta oportunidad ella esa solicitando su segundo credito porque nececita comprar mas mercaderia y con el capital que tiene no le alcanza, ya que sus clientes han aumentado gracias a la variedad de productos que tiene en su venta y eso gracias a la ayuda de kiva, espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
Maria Pilar is a member of this group.  She is 40 years old and has 7 children.  She sells food staples such as beans, rice, oil, ham, etc.  She has done this work for the past 5 years, and thanks to God her business has gone well.

She has already had a previous loan from Kiva and she didn't fall behind on her payments.  She is a hard-working woman with a passion to improve herself and her situation every day.  She is seeking a loan (her second) because she needs to buy merchandise and in her current economic situation, she cannot afford it.  

Maria Pilar increased the number of customers in her store due to the variety of products that she offers, and this is all thanks to the previous Kiva loan.  She hopes that she can get some help again with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy food staples such as beans, rice, oil, ham, etc. for sale.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en: Hamisi appreciates his previous loan that improved his living standards. His previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income. He would like to apply for a loan of ksh.10,000 to buy more bales of clothes for resale. He thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a woman of 31 years. She is married to Joseph and together they have two children. She runs a beauty salon and has been in this business for six years now. She has a monthly income of 25,000 shillings.

This will be Alice's third loan with KADET. She plans to use the entire loan to buy beauty products like hair relaxer, hair shampoo, etc. In the future she wants to own a bigger salon and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products like shampoo, hair relaxer, etc.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 52-year-old single woman with 2 children, ages 20 and 25. She describes herself as determined. She operates a farm where she keeps poultry to produce eggs to sell. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of funds. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy chicken feed. 

Her business goal is to be a chicken meat distributor within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will be successfully employed. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Jose Alcides

texts.es:
José, se siente complacido con el servicio que la da institución y los múltiples beneficios que obtiene al hacer uso de los créditos, con el capital comprara abono, insecticidas, fertilizantes y plaguicidas, con lo que efectuará la preparación de la tierra para sembrar maíz.
Con el crédito anterior José, obtuvo una producción abundante, granos de mucha calidad, mayores ingresos, pudo cancelar su deuda y ofrece a su familia una mejor alimentación, todos se encuentra saludables.
texts.en:
Jose is pleased with the service from this institution and the many benefits that come along with these loans.  With this loan he will buy manure, insecticides, fertilizers, and pesticides, which will be used to prepare the land for planting corn.

With his previous loan, Jose increased his production and the quality of his crops.  He earned a higher income and was able to pay off debt.  He provided his family with better sustenance and everyone is healthy.

loans.use: to buy manure, insecticides, fertilizers, and pesticides.

loans.name: Gibril        A

texts.en:
Gibril is 40 years old, married, and has one child. He is	 from OIC, Ropolo in the northern area of Sierra Leone. He was trained in business, so he considered it as the best choice for him. Gibril runs a general merchandise business, which he has been doing for 13 years. He sells soft drinks, toothpaste, and cigarettes. He works 12 hours a day, six days a week. The main challenges are the high cost of rent for his shop and insufficient capital to expand his business.

Gibril is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy more soft drinks, toothpaste, and cigarettes to sell. The extra income from this loan will allow him to become a successful businessman and improve his family's standard of living. In the future, Gibril plans to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, toothpaste, and cigarettes

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica sells cows at the market to earn a living. She has been engaged in her business for the past two years. She reports that her main business challenge has been unstable market prices. 

She and her husband have a baby and four children. All four children attend school. The family lives in a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Their greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Monica joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds for her business. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 KES to purchase cows to offer for sale.

loans.use: to purchase cows to offer for sale

loans.name: Ayati

texts.en:
Ayati lives in Bogor, a suburban area located about an hour from Jakarta. Ayati and three other family members live together in her house. She is an entrepreneur who runs a small stall that sells cell phone accessories, mobile phone airtime credits, and bill payment service for her customers. Ayati joined Ruma because she's interested in expanding her business. Previously, she took a working capital loan from Kiva and she already paid it back on time. 

Ayati is currently requesting another loan from Kiva because she sees a sales opportunity on weekends as more customers come to her small shop to buy mobile phone airtime credits. For the last months, she has been able to process around 30-31% higher sales volume on weekends than on weekdays. Ayati hopes that she can improve her small stall and put aside the extra cash for her family savings. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To obtain more float to process mobile phone credit sales and bill payments on weekends

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 34-year-old 	Ibrahim from OIC Ropolo, Northern area in Sierra Leone. He is married with 2 children.  He started his business because he thinks it the best option for him.  

Ibrahim runs a business to sell a variety of drinks and cigarettes. He has run this business since 2008 and works12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Ibrahim says that the main challenge to him is the high cost of licenses and taxes.

Ibrahim has requested a loan to buy more soft drinks, alcohol and cigarettes for resale.  The extra income from this loan will allow him to become a successful business man and improve his family's standard of living. In the future, Ibrahim plans to expand his business. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, alcohol and cigarettes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and a weighing scale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome, age 57, earns her living by operating a retail business where she sells second-hand goods, such as furniture and electronics. She describes herself to be enterprising and she has been involved in her business for seven years. Her business is located in an area that has high potential for sales and she has many regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the slow movement of goods. 

Salome and her husband have six children, with ages ranging from 13 to 27 years old. 

She will use her Kes 20,000 loan funds to add a new stock of furniture, electronics, and other items to offer for sale. Her business objective is to have a bigger store within five years. Her primary goal for the future is to sustain her family through her business.

loans.use: to buy second-hand furniture, electronics, and other items to offer for sale

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice, age 32, earns her living by operating a retail business where she sells jikos (charcoal-burning stoves). She considers herself to be a determined entrepreneur and has been involved in her business for the past three years. Her business is located in an environment with high potential for sales, and she has gained a regular clientele of both small-scale and large-scale customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be slow sales. 

Loice and her husband have two small children, ages two and six years old.

She has requested a loan in the amount of Kes 10,000. She will use her loan funds to buy jikos to offer for sale. Her business objective is to enable her enterprise to become more successful within five years. Her goal for the future is to be prosperous.

loans.use: to buy jikos to offer for sale

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a 48-year-old married woman with 2 children. She describes herself as a person who can cope with uncertainties. She operates a tailoring shop to make suits for both men and women. She has been involved in this business for 11 years. Her business is located in a market place and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge as having inadequate funds. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy fabric, thread, and other materials to make clothes. 

Her business goal is to open more shops within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will maximize profits. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and other materials to make clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tops, skirts, t-shirts, pants, and outfits for children.

loans.name: Farhia

texts.en: Farhia appreciates the support from Kiva and Yehu at large which helped her to buy foods and consumables for sale. Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of Kshs 20,000 to buy cooking oil, wheat flour, rice and maize flour for resale to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, wheat flour, rice and maize flour for resale

loans.name: Faasolo

texts.en: Faasolo is 58 years old and is married with 7 children. She runs a small business selling snacks and finger foods in her community and has been doing this for 3 years. Faasolo has requested a loan to buy snacks, chicken, sausages, rice, onions, soy sauce, mutton flaps, foam plates, curry and cooking oil. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Faasolo will help meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy snacks, chicken, sausages, rice, onions, soy sauce, mutton flaps, foam plates, curry and cooking oil.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a hard-working mother who dreams of becoming financially stable in the future. She is 47 years old and is blessed with three children. She aims to make her business profitable in order to support the education of her children. She plans to increase her product offerings but she doesn't have enough capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy more stocks of rice, soft drinks, beverages, seasonings, biscuits and chips to sell. Through her hard work and strong determination, she believes that she will achieve her goals someday.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice, soft drinks, beverages, seasonings, biscuits and chips to sell.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is asking for a loan because she believes that it will help her improve her business.  The previous loan enabled her to save money from her mat weaving business and helped her to pay school fees for her children. She requests  a loan of 40,000 KES to purchase more palm leaves for her mat business.

She feels that she made a good investment with her previous loan because she was able to maintain a profit which meets the family's personal expenses.

loans.use: to purchase more palm leaves for her mat business.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is a married woman with two children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over three years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase a stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Abdul from OIC Ropolo, Northern area in Sierra Leone. He is married with three children. Two of his children are currently attending school. In 1993, Abdul established his clothing business. He was in masonry; he started his clothing business to take care of his family welfare and improve his status of living. He works at the business from 7:00 a.m. until 7:00 a.m., six days per week. He says that the main challenge to his business is the high cost of transportation.

Abdul requires a loan in order to buy more shirts, jeans, and other items for resale. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to increase his business and repay his loan. In the future, Abdul plans to expand his business more than ever. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more shirts, jeans, and other items for resale

loans.name: Candida

texts.en:
Candida is 27 years old, and she is now applying for a loan of $1.000 to improve her business.  

She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of $ 50.  She earns a good income from her business.

She will use her loan to buy some stock to keep in her store such as body lotion, hard drinks (beer), soft drinks (Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko), noodles, milk, cigarettes, and bread.  

She is a very hard-working woman, and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 13 years. 

She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy body lotion, hard drinks (beer), soft drinks (Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko), noodles, milk, cigarettes, and bread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more timber to expand his furniture business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a variety of spare motor parts like engine oil and tires.

loans.name: Augusta

texts.en:
$ 1000.00 USD is requested by Augusta to improve her business.She is married to a farmer and has four children.  She has a kiosk where many people buy items every day.  Her loan will enable her to buy additional supplies such as cement, zinc and wood. She has been involved in this business since 2011. She enjoys being able to earn money every day.

Running a business has made Augusta independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy cement, zinc and wood

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 47-year-old divorced mother of two children for whom she sacrificed her whole life to provide them with the necessary standards of living. She has been working as a tailor since 1992 to earn her own living and support her children. Amina is a hard worker who keeps improving her business to please her customers as much as she can, where most of them are relatives and neighbors.

Amina is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to pay for the necessary diesel oil she needs to keep her beloved family warm during the coming winter season. 

This will be Amina's twelfth loan cycle with Al Majmoua, and she has a good standing in repayment history. 

She hopes to buy a more professional sewing machine in the future; that will make her work faster and easier.

loans.use: to pay for the necessary diesel oil she needs to keep her beloved family warm during the coming winter season.

loans.name: Monika

texts.en: Monika is 34 years old and is married with 3 children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, cabbages, cucumbers and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years. Monika needs a loan to buy vegetable seeds, taro root crops, chemicals, a crowbar, a digging stick, bush knives, a rake, a wheelbarrow and a backpack sprayer. Monika will use the profits from her sales to save for her children's education and to support her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, taro root crops, chemicals, a crowbar, a digging stick, bush knives, a rake, a wheelbarrow and a backpack sprayer.

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунира разведенная и не имеет детей. Она трудолюбивая женщина. Мунира является повторной клиенткой ИМОНа. Она первый раз участвовала в курсе «Добейся Успеха» и организовала, таким образом, свой бизнес купле продажей скота. Она успешно введет своё дело. Мунира хочет расширить свой бизнес и таким образом увеличить доход. Мунира запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Munira is divorced and has no children. She iso a hardworking woman and a repeat client at IMON International. She first participated in the course "Achieve Success" and afterward began a business buying and selling livestock. She is successfully running the business and wants to expand to increase her revenue. She is asking for a loan of 6,000 somoni to buy cattle. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle for resale

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with eight school-aged children.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food .

She has operated a fish selling business for the last three years and sells at the market to her neighbors and customers. The different seasons affect her business. 

With the loan of  20,000 KES, she will purchase fish, cooking oil, and firewood. She decided to join to acquire financial services for her business

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Kimitei

texts.en:
Kimitei is a 50-year-old married man with 4 children between the ages of 11 and 19. He describes himself as a confident person. 

He operates a farm to raise animals and grow tea. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are small-scale buyers. His biggest business challenge is the change in weather conditions which affect tea growth. He will use the 15000 KES to buy a dairy cow and tea leaves. His business goal is to excel within 5 years. 

This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and tea leaves for resale.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is 49 years of age and is engaged in the farming business. He wants to uplift his family out of poverty through his farming business. 

For him to achieve his goal, he decided to request a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy rice seeds and pesticides and to pay for labor costs in transplanting his rice farmland.

He is hoping that his requested loan will be approved so he can obtain a plentiful harvest, have greater income and improve his way of living.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and pesticides and to pay for labor costs in transplanting his rice farmland.

loans.name: Mwikali

texts.en:
This is Mwikali. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more items for the business. She has been in this business for years now and it keeps on growing. 

Mwikali would like to apply for a loan of KES 80,000 to buy more stocks of household consumables, eggs, wheat flour, maize flour, rice, sweets, and sugar. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell should result in greater profit. Mwikali's profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household consumables, eggs, wheat flour, maize flour, rice, sweets, and sugar.

loans.name: Amelia Estela

texts.es:
Amelia, necesita capital para invertir en compra de carnes, maíz, frijoles, verduras, arroz y bebidas para ofrecer un menú amplio a sus clientes en su comedor y así contar con su fidelidad por el buen servicio que les brinda.
Con el préstamo anterior adquirió los ingredientes necesarios para elaborar los diferentes platillos que vende en su comedor, sus ventas aumentaron, cancelo deudas, y su economía se estableció. Da a su familia una mejor alimentación, salud y vestuario.
texts.en:
Amelia needs a loan so that she can buy meat, corn, beans, vegetables, rice, and beverages in order to improve the menu in her restaurant and increase the number of customers.  She also wants to keep her loyal customers happy by continuing to provide great service.

With her previous loan she purchased the ingredients she needed to make different plates that she sold in her restaurant.  Her sales increased, she paid off debt, and her economic situation stabilized.  She can now provide her family with better sustenance, health, and clothing.

loans.use: to buy meat, corn, beans, vegetables, and rice.

loans.name: Jose Vidal

texts.es:
José, necesita capital para adquirir abono, fertilizantes, insecticidas y pago de alquiler del terreno en el que cultivara. Con esta compra tendrá lo necesario para sembrar sin ningún problema.
Con el préstamo anterior tuvo los insumos agrícolas necesarios para tener una cosecha abundante, granos calidad, su economía mejoro y sigue contribuyendo a las mejoras del estilo de vidafamiliar.
texts.en:
José needs capital to purchase compost, fertilizers and insecticides, and to pay the rent for the land where he farms. With this purchase, he will have what he needs to plant without any problem.

With the previous loan, he had the necessary agricultural inputs to have an abundant harvest and quality grains. His financial situation improved and he continues contributing to improvements in his family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers and insecticides, and to pay the lease for the land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchases more malaria drugs, pain tablets,  and cholera drugs to expand her business.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan, tiene 32 años de edad, es casado vive junto a su esposa, se dedica a la comercialización de granos básicos y cultivo de maíz, lo hace desde que era muy joven, lo aprendió de su papá, hasta la fecha no ha tenido ningún problema en realizar esta actividad.
Solicita capital para comprar abono, fertilizantes, semilla y pago de mano de obra, lo que le ayudara a cultivar una manzana de tierra y a tener una mejor cosecha de maíz, espera mejorar sus ingresos para cancelar las cuotas y cubrir los gastos de su hogar.
Aspira a fortalecer más el negocio para recibir mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Juan is 32 years old, married, and lives with his wife. He makes his living selling bulk grains and growing corn. He has been doing this since he was very young. He learned it from his father, and until now, he has not had any problems in this business.

He is applying for a loan to buy compost, fertilizers and seeds, and to pay for labor, which will help him to plant a plot of land and to have a better corn harvest. He hopes to improve his income so that he can make his payments and cover household expenses.

He aspires to strengthen his business and to receive better earnings.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers and seeds, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Lamin

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 47-year-old 	Lamin from OIC Ropolo, Northern area in Sierra Leone. He is married with five children.  He was operating a tailoring business, but customers were not coming so he started his assorted drinks business because it has fast sales and quick turnover.  

Lamin runs his assorted drinks business; He sells soft drinks, Star beer and cigarettes. He has been running this business since 2003. He works at the business 12 hours per day and 6 days per week. Lamin says that the main challenge to his business is poor electrical power supply.

Lamin has requested a loan in order to buy more soft drinks, Star beer and cartons of cigarettes for resale.  The extra income from this loan will allow him to become successful businessman and improve his family's standard of living. In the future, Lamin plans to expand his business to another outlet. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, Star beer and cartons of cigarettes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, drinks and spices to expand her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more onions and carton tomatoes to offer for sale

loans.name: Popchin

texts.en:
Popchin is a 32-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, rice, and drinks. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a conducive environment and her primary customers are small scale.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations of goods. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to add a stock of sugar, rice, drinks, etc. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add a stock of sugar, rice, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en:
Onesmus is a 54-year-old married man. He has five children with ages ranging from 19 years to 26 years. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows which produce milk for sale. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are small scale. 

Onesmus describes his biggest business challenge to be poor milk storage facilities. He will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy stock of animal feed. His business goal is to excel within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy stock of animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
