Judith is a married woman and has children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has no electricity or piped water.

She has operated a retail business for the past one year, selling household consumables, such as wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She dreams of getting enough money to help her build her own premises for the business in the future.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married woman with seven children; two of whom are underage and five attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family. 

For the past two years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth operates a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling her wares from her home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation of goods to her place of operation. To supplement her income, she rears and sells chickens. 

Ruth and her husband both contribute their incomes toward the upbringing and support of their children. The family lives in a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Ruth decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She has requested a loan in the amount of Kshs 10,000. With her loan funds, she will purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions, and fruit to offer for sale.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions, and fruit to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more "Lapper" (fabric) for her business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is still single with no children.

For over three years, she has operated a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women, and curtains. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials, and sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials, and sewing threads for her business.

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois is 39 years old. He is married with two children. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. 

With the profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase items such as soap, toothpaste, and rice to offer for sale

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en:
Eseta is 42 years old and married with three children. She makes and sells pancakes to earn a living and has been doing this for two years.

Eseta has requested a loan to buy flour, dripping oil, baking soda, eggs, a large basin and a kerosene oven. 

She plans to use her profits to extend her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy flour, dripping oil, baking soda, eggs, a large basin and a kerosene oven.

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en:
Uranchimeg, 22 years old, lives with her father and brother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been running a jewelry shop since 2010 and she usually obtains her goods from Thailand quarterly. Her father transports goods between provinces for a living. Her brother has the position of manager at an airline company. Her mother lives separately in the countryside. 

Uranchimeg is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to travel to Thailand and bring back a large amount of jewelry before Christmas. During the five days before Christmas, the demand for jewelry increases greatly so she shouldn't have a shortage of jewelry. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of jewelry to sell

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married mother of two children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees for her children and transport.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 25,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Moelagi

texts.en:
Moelagi is a 41-year-old married woman with three children. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business.

Moelagi needs a loan to buy cordial, sugar, plastic bags, a cooler and a deep freezer. She plans to use her profits to support her family and kids. 

Moelagi became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy cordial, sugar, plastic bags, a cooler and a deep freezer.

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Savy is married and 29 years old. She has two children, who live under her care and are attending a local primary school. Savy lives with her family in the Prasat Bakong district of Siem Reap province. 

To help her husband earn income for the family, Savy manages the planting and harvesting of rice on a small piece of land. Savy has been involved in farming for almost 13 years. 

As of now, Savy is taking out a loan to add to her capital to make home improvements.. Her house, which has been built for years, has deteriorated and needs to be fixed instantly. 

She and her family are very thankful to all the lenders for helping them improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to add to her capital to repair her house

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
This is Delia. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another loan, this time for 17,000 PHP, to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her child’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Delia dreams to expand her network and connections and hopes to have financial freedom. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, pepper, salt, and other such items to offer for sale

loans.name: Nazeeran's Group

texts.en:
Nazeeran is a 43-year old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of seven children. Her husband provides white wash and oil painting services to his customers withiin the community and sometimes he also has to go out of the city. 

Nazreen's husband has a new contract for the white wash and oil painting of a newly constructed house but he has no paint brushes or rollers for providing these services. Nazeeran has requested a loan for her husband so he will be able to buy new paint brushes, rollers, kerosene oil, etc.
Nazreen wants to change this condition for her family and hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her husband. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy paint brushes, rollers and multi-color paints.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo is 56 years old and operates his farming business.

He has run this kind of business for more than nine years, and he is grateful because he was able to know more farming practices to improve it. According to him, farming is not easy because it is laborious work and requires the proper application of farm inputs. 

With his determination to improve his way of living and increase his yield this next harvest season, he has requested financial assistance amounting to PHP 30,000. He will use this loan amount in purchasing rice seeds, fertilizer, and insecticides.

He believes that progress on his business relies on his proper care and complete application of farm inputs. Leonardo is hoping for approval of his requested loan amount.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizer, and insecticides for use in farming

loans.name: Maka

texts.en:
Maka, who is a 27-year-old young woman, lives in Ozurgeti district. She lives with her parents, who have no income nowadays. Maka has secondary education, that's why she couldn't find any state job. She started her own private activity and opened a clothing store.
 
However, thanks to her hard work during recent years, Maka has been able to run her business in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, the start-up program, which enables people to start or re-start businesses.
 
She is requesting a loan to increase her business merchandise with more seasonal clothes that will fulfill customers' needs and requests.
Maka hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand her business to a wider store that covers almost all of her customers' needs.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of clothes and expand her activity.

loans.name: Prokobi

texts.en:
Prokobi is from the village of Lesichine. He is 39 years old, married and lives with his retired parents, wife and one school-age child. The family earns a living through an agricultural business and breeds three cows, two of which are milking. Prokobi sells dairy products at the local open market. Besides this, he also grows and sells nuts and laurel leaves and generates seasonal income. 

In order to earn more funds and improve the standard of living of his family members, Prokobi plans to start a new business. If his loan is raised on the Kiva website, he will buy a lemonade-filling machine and start producing soft drinks. 

He will sell his produce among locals and distribute them to groceries. Prokobi will get additional monthly income and hopes his initiative will be successful.

loans.use: to buy a lemonade-filling machine and start producing soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for the business.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is 37-years-old, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  She is the mother of five children.  Her husband has been running a restaurant successfully for many years and handling the financial condition of his house. She has been investing the amount of previous loans in the current business and has been establishing the restaurant well. She is an old member of BRAC Pakistan and now she is in her third loan cycle.  Her payment schedule and behavior is very good.

This time Shahida is taking a loan again for the establishment of the restaurant. In fact, the restaurant needs to be white washed, a little bit of maintenance, a sauce pan for cooking and crockery as well. Shahida is hopeful that after taking this loan that it would be the cause to earn more profit and savings as well. Shahida thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy food items, crockery and to white wash her restaurant.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
This is Marina. She previously obtained a PHP 15,000 loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in her personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another PHP 15,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marina dreams to be more successful in business and hopes that her family will always be in good condition.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their lives and business every week and  draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Uzziel

texts.en:
Uzziel is 54 years old. He is married with one child, aged 16. 

He would like to use Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Karamat

texts.en:
Karamat is 48 years old. He is married with four children. Karamat works hard to be able to cover his family's basic costs and at the same time provide  appropriate living conditions for them.

He is engaged in selling amplifying feed products for animals. With the profits, he wishes to invest the business so that in the future, he can acquire machine and tractor that will help his farming capacity.

His younger son, 19 years old, studies at University. He is currently in his fourth year of study in the pediatric department. This is the reason Karamat asks for this loan. With the help of the loan, he will be able to cover university tuition and the loan will be a great support for him.

loans.use: To cover his son's university tuition.

loans.name: Ulziibayar

texts.en: Mr. Ulziibayar, 30 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in an old house on a plot of land. He has been working as a car driver at a private firm for one year. His wife makes house decorations on contract with entities and individuals. The house they live in has been deteriorating over the years and is threatened by strong storms and snowfall. So he is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cements, fiberglass and foam. Using those materials, he will repair and insulate his house, thus creating a comfortable and warm place for his family. Overall advantage of renovation is that the family will no longer require large amounts of coal for heating. Less coal burning means less pollutants in air.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials

loans.name: Mafi

texts.en:
Mafi is a 32-year-old woman with three children. She owns and operates a business venture, sewing. She has three years of experience in this line of business.

Mafi needs a loan to buy thread, a set of roll materials, an overlock machine, dozens of buttons, and scissors. 

She hopes to use her profits to improve her business and help her family matters. She joined SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy thread, a set of roll materials, an overlock machine, dozens of buttons, and scissors.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a single man. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using a motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a rural area, and his primary customers are small scale. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be changes in weather conditions. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy spare parts for his motorbike. His business goal is to excel within five years. He hopes that he will have a bright future. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the motorbike he uses in his transport business.

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Phat lives in the village of Trapeang Chong, Bakan District, Pursat. She is 54 years old, married, and a loving mother of eight children. Three children are married, and five children are single. Phat and her husband manage an agricultural business growing rice to earn an income for the family. They grow rice on the family-owned plot of land and sell to local traders in the region.

With the purpose of aiming to improve the family’s living conditions, Phat is asking for a loan to build a safe latrine for the household. The water loan program is offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) with a special interest rate. This loan helps to encourage Phat to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a safe latrine for the household.

loans.name: Damascene

texts.en:
Damascene is 56 years old. He is married, with eight children. 

With the loan, he would like to use the money to buy fertilizer during maize production; he needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and pay labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is married with five school-going children. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Ruth has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business for the past two years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is married, and has five children, three in school and two underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a poultry-selling business. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the Ksh 20,000 she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feeds. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes appreciates Kiva and Yehu Microfinance Trust for their financial support. The profit she earned from the previous loan enabled her to establish another business. She sells poultry in addition to selling groceries.

She is requesting for a loan of 10,000 KSH to purchase more poultry and chicken feed. She looks forward to boosting her business.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry and chicken feed

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet

loans.name: Saran's Group

texts.en:
Saran, aged 18, living in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district, has one child. She and her husband grow rice to make a living. Sometime they work for others for a fee. From the current business, they can earn about 27,000KHR per day but they can save about KHR10,000 after daily expenses. 
This is the micro loan for Saran’s group with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan. Saran who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her rice paddy so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cold water by the sack for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil, pepper, Maggi cube, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blood syrup, pain tablets, malarial drugs and cholera medicine to expand his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase used clothing to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more dry meat for her business.

loans.name: Yeabu

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Yeabu from Jui Eastern in Freetown. She is married with three children. One of her children is currently attending school. 

During the past five years, Yeabu established her local food business. She began her business because she wants to create a permanent source of income to support her children. She works at the business for 10 hours per day and six days per week. She says that a major problem for her business is that it is sometimes very difficult to travel around the area to sell her goods.

Yeabu requires a loan in order to purchase groundnut, okra, and sweet potatoes for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, Yeabu plans to open a large food store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy groundnut, okra, and sweet potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 27-year-old Fatmata from Jui Eastern in Freetown. She is married with three children between the ages of six and 11. One of her children is currently attending school. 

In 2003, Fatmata established her plastic slippers business within a busy market area. She began her business because she needs to create a permanent source of income to support the home. She works at the business for eight hours per day, seven days per week. She says that at present her business is doing well.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more plastic slippers for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to pay for her children's school expenses and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic slippers for resale.

loans.name: Sajdha

texts.en:
Sajdha is a 36-year-old married woman, living with her spouse and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Her husband owns a small clothing shop in which he sells clothing related to ladies and gents. He has been running this business for many years and cherishing his whole family. Now with the increase in their needs, they consider it necessary to grow the business also. Along his clothing business, he wants to offer ready-made garments as well. However, due to the lack of availability of funds, he is unable to buy ready-made garments.
Therefore, Sajdha took a loan for her husband’s business. With the help of this loan, her husband will purchase ready-made garments to resell.

loans.use: to buy ready-made garments for resale.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra, age 35, is a homemaker. She lives with her husband and their three sons in Lahore. Her whole family is fully dependent upon her husband, who provides the family's sole source of income. 
 
Bushra's husband owns a workshop where he provides services for painting and assembling auto-rickshaws. He removes dents and paint from rickshaw bodies in need of repair, then applies fresh paint to provide renewed vehicles. He spent all his available savings on the building and maintenance of this workshop in order to best support his family.

His stock of paints is now exhausted, and he does not have the available funds to buy the necessary paint required for his workshop to continue to offer services. Therefore, Bushra has requested a loan so that her husband can buy new cans of paint for his workshop.

loans.use: to help her husband buy cans of paint for his auto-rickshaw repair workshop

loans.name: Rozina

texts.en:
Rozina is a 45-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is passing her life with her husband and two sons.
Her husband is a very hardworking and honest person. He owns a small restaurant in which he offers types of delicious foods. He hired a worker for his restaurant and he has to pay a salary to that worker. 

He has been running his restaurant for many years, and this is the reason why most of the chairs, utensils, and crockery have broken. This is the reason he wants to buy utensils and crockery, but the majority of his income is spent over household expenses.
 
Therefore, Rozina requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy utensils and crockery.

loans.use: to buy utensils and crockery for the restaurant.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is a 50-years old married woman. She is taking loan for her son as he has to buy new body for an auto rickshaw. Her son ha been driving an auto rickshaw for many years in Lahore, Pakistan. He drives rickshaw by days and nights, trying to earn maximum profit. A few weeks ago her son was driving his rickshaw on the road, as usual, and unintentionally collapsed a pole. Due to the collision, the rickshaw body got seriously damaged. This has caused the passengers to feel uncomfortable during traveling.

Musarat has requested a loan so that her son can repair the rickshaw body so that he can drive it smoothly again. Her son is responsible for a sibling as well as his own children.

loans.use: to buy rickshaw body for her son.

loans.name: Kule

texts.en:
This is Kule. She previously obtained a loan that she used to buy more goats for her business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She is requesting a loan of 50,000 KSH to purchase five goats for her business. She appreciates Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase five goats for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: with tuition fees

loans.name: Faaae

texts.en: Faaae is a 43-year-old married woman with six children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for two years. Faaae has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, dripping oil, plastic bags, baking soda, and eggs. She joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Faaae will provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, dripping oil, plastic bags, baking soda, and eggs.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en: Dennis is 31 years old. He is a farmer within the village of Gattaran and has been in business for three years. He plans to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to improve his rice farmland but his capital intended for his farming business is not enough.  With regards to this matter, he is requesting a loan amount of PHP 10,000.  Dennis hopes to get this loan in order to improve his yield and financial stability.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides for his farming business

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is 29 years old. He is married to a farmer and they have been in the business for the past four years. With the Kiva loan, he would like to buy fertilizers during maize production; he needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
María, se decidió por otro crédito debido a la necesidad de invertir en su negocio en esta época navideña que es cuando las ventas aumentan, comprará azúcar, arroz, jabón, maíz, etc., para surtir la tienda y tener más clientes satisfechos.
Con el crédito anterior equipo la tienda, aumento sus ventas, mejoro sus ingresos, atrajo nuevos clientes, ofrece una mejor atención a sus clientes y ha podido cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en:
Maria has decided to seek another loan as she needs to prepare her business for the Christmas season, which is when sales increase. She plans to buy sugar, rice, soap, corn, and other items to stock her shop and increase the number of satisfied customers. 

With the previous loan, Maria stocked the shop, increased her sales, improved her income, drew in new customers, was able to offer better customer service, and pay off her debts.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, soap, corn, etc.

loans.name: Fedai

texts.en: Fedai is a taxi driver. He is married, and father of three children, ages five, four and two. This is the first time he has applied for a loan. A few months ago, his wife got sick and had to stay in hospital to get treatment.  Due to this, Fedai needs 1000 AZN to cover the treatment costs.  He is a hardworking man and hopes to give good education to his children in future.

loans.use: To cover his wife's treatment costs.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea, es casada, vive junto a su esposo, desde hace 20 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos, es una actividad que aprendió junto a sus padres, con la experiencia ha evitado dificultades en su administración.
El capital lo invertirá en la compra de concentrado, vacunas y desparasitante para cerdos, lo que le dará oportunidad de darles un cuido muy adecuado para así hacer más fácil su comercialización, espera fortalecer su negocio, mejorar sus ganancias con las cuales cumplirá con la cancelación de las cuotas y aportara a los gastos familiares.
Aspira mantener su negocio activo y rentable para tener un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Andrea is married, lives with her husband, and has been raising and selling pigs, which she learned from her parents.  Her experience has prevented having trouble managing the business.

She will use the money from this loan to buy feed, vaccinations, and anti-parasite medication for pigs, which will provide the opportunity to give them adequate care to make their sale easier.  She hopes to strengthen the business, and improve her earnings so she can repay the debt and cover the family expenses. 

She wants to maintain her business active and profitable so she can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy feed and supplies.

loans.name: Sitha's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Sitha, 57, has five children in total. Sitha and her husband are rice farmers who have been farming for five years to make a living and sometimes they work for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 40,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 
Sitha is the third cycled client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group of three to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Thelma Elizabeth

texts.es:
Telma, opta por un nuevo crédito para realizar la compra de terneros para el repasto, lo que da la pauta para continuar creciendo en el negocio y mejorando las condiciones familiares.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a fortalecer su negocio, a mejorar sus ingresos los cuales le sirven para cancelar las cuotas y dar a su familia una mejor alimentación, vestuario y salud.
texts.en:
Telma has requested a new loan in order to buy calves to raise for food, which will provide a template for continuing to grow her business and improving her family living conditions.

The previous loan helped her to strengthen her business and improve her income, which allowed her to meet her repayments and give her family better food, clothes and health.

loans.use: to buy calves to raise for food.

loans.name: Zviad

texts.en:
Zviad is an experienced farmer from the village of Nagomari in the Ozurgeti district. He lives with his mother, wife, and three kindergarten-aged daughters. 

To take care of his family’s everyday needs, Zviad is engaged in breeding cattle, beekeeping, and cultivating maize and nuts. He sells the agricultural products, mainly dairy, at the local market. This is the main source of the family’s income. 

This income isn't enough to meet all the daily needs of his family. A loan of 1500 GEL will be a huge support to this hard-working man and his family. The loan will enable Zviad to purchase a stock of clothing and to start a business. He will sell the clothing locally in his village and in nearby villages as well. 

Zviad has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up program enables rural poor to start or re-start businesses. 

Zviad and his family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping to start a business selling clothing.

loans.use: to start a business selling clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soap for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fashion shower slippers for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is a Peruvian artisan who makes handcrafted wood jewelry boxes, mirrors and home decor. Antonio hopes to stock up on materials to craft his products, and also to invest in tools for his workshop. Antonio has been selling through NOVICA since 2005. This is his story: "I'd describe my work as life itself, and my existence together with it. When I was only 17, I created my first piece and it was an immense satisfaction. Art guides my hands in that moment of pleasure as I begin a design. My pieces are inspired by the olden times and reflect the style of vintage pieces. They transmit my love for life and for nature — its flowers, birds and all the rich flora and fauna of our country." "I'm very grateful to all of you who are helping artisans to develop new designs and keep them in stock. I plan to use the money for materials and tools that will help us more quickly craft our designs for you." Use the link below to view Antonio's wood mirrors, jewelry boxes and home decor on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/5387

loans.use: to stock up on materials to craft his products, and also to invest in tools for his workshop

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Salamatu from Jui Eastern in Freetown. She is single with one child.

During the past two years, Salamatu established her cooking business. She began her business because she wants to create a permanent source of income to support her child. She works at the business for 15 hours per day and six days per week. She says that her business is doing well because out of the cooking season she is able to take care of her relatives.

Salamatu requires a loan in order to buy more fish, rice, palm oil, and cooking seasonings to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her child and increase her business. In the future, Salamatu plans to open a big restaurant. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more fish, rice, palm oil, and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 37-year-old Kumba from Jui, eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 4 children. Three of her children are attending school. 

Kumba runs a retails business. She sells drinks, ginger juice and pure water. She has been running this business for 4 years. She works at the business 8 hours per day, 7 days per week.  Kumba says that her major problem to her business is lack of enough capital to expand her business.

Kumba has requested a loan in order to purchase more drinks, ginger juice and pure water. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her stand of living and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more drinks, ginger juice and pure water.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a Ghanaian artisan who creates hand-carved wood masks. He would like to invest in the raw materials he uses for his authentic African masks. Robert has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story: "After four years of working with my brother, I left his workshop to start on my own. Presently, I work along with expert artists, all designers and carvers. I focus on design and work with local Ghanaian woods. I love my art and I hope to produce more interesting designs for my customers." "I will be always grateful for the help you all are giving to me and to all my artist colleagues. Thank you." Use the link below to view Robert's hand-carved wood masks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/2538

loans.use: to invest in the raw materials he uses for his authentic African masks

loans.name: Salomon

texts.en:
Salomon is a Peruvian artisan who creates colorful ceramic masks. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase raw materials for the Andean masks he creates.

Salomon has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"I am a self-taught artist, dedicating myself to ceramics since my youth. I specialize in masks influenced by the Vicus, Moche, and Nazca cultures. I focus largely on the mix of form and color: despite a lack of formal training I have created a unique, personal style. I hope to improve my work with each passing day, and achieve a style that is gratifying for me and that it will resonate in people's hearts and minds."

"I'm very grateful for your support, which will permit me to keep my current designs in stock and develop new ones for you. Thank you so much."

To view Salomon's ceramic masks on the Novica site, visit www.novica.com/kiva/810.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for the Andean masks he creates

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase drinks, pure water, and ice blocks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stock to expand her general store business.

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina is a 41-year old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five daughters and two sons. 

Robina requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband. Her husband is a shoe maker and an expert in his profession. He has been manufacturing shoes for many years. This is the reason he has a lot of experience in his profession. He sews leather and rexine shoes through a machine, after that, he attaches a sole through stitching done with his hands. In this way, he is earning income for his family. He has been making shoes at home.  Now he has established a shop to continue his business on a wide scale. But he does not have the amount to buy the initial raw materials for making shoes.

Therefore, Robina requested a loan for her husband so he can buy the initial raw material for making shoes.  Her family has to do hard work to earn an income for a huge family.  Her sons also participate in the monthly income. Robina wants  her daughter to marry, this is why she is saving most of the earnings.

loans.use: To help her husband buy raw materials to make shoes.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a Guatemalan artisan who makes handcrafted ceramic ornaments and figurines. He would like to purchase paints and materials for his ceramics to continue production. Jose has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story: "My favorite thing to do is to create new designs, and I love the challenge of crafting and painting them by hand. Each design is proof of the richness of our culture. Working with ceramics has brought me many beautiful things, from learning the craft from my mother and uncles, to providing for my family so that my four children can go to the university. I already have a grandchild, and my wish for all of them is that they become independent people with a career of their choice, and that they be responsible and be respectful of God." "I'll always be grateful for the help you are offering me. In 2014, I want to introduce new designs and, with this loan, I'll be able to buy the paints and brushes I need to continue creating works of ceramic art. The paints require a big investment, and being able to buy them at wholesale prices is a great advantage. Thank you so much!" Use the link below to view Jose's ceramic art on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7521

loans.use: to purchase paints and materials for his ceramics to continue production

loans.name: Eteuini

texts.en: Etuini is a 39 year-old married woman who has eight children. She would like to start a small business selling elei lavalava in her community. In order to do this, Etuini needs a loan to buy stencils, fabric color paint, materials, a roller and elei carved design board. She hopes to use her profits to save for family needs. She has been a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy stencils, fabric color paint, materials, roller and elei carved design board

loans.name: Pantaleon

texts.es:
Pantaleón, es casado, vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, se dedica a comercializar verduras, granos, básicos y pollos vivos, lo aprendió de su padre, su horario es de 6:00 a.m. hasta las 3:00 p.m., hasta la fecha su negocio no le ha representado ninguna dificultad.
Con el crédito comprara concentrado para pollos, frijoles, maíz, lo que le ayudara a tener más producto para que sus clientes encuentren lo necesario y mantengan su fidelidad con el negocio, espera mejorar su economía.
Su sueño es tener los recursos necesarios para darle a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Pantaleón is married, lives with his wife and four children, and sells vegetables, basic grains, and live chickens, which he learned from his father.  He works from 6:00 am to 3:00 pm and has not had any problems with his business.

He will use the money from this loan to buy chickens, beans, and corn, which will help him increase his inventoryso that his customers find what they need and remain loyal to the business.  He hopes to improve his finances. 

His dream is to have the resources necessary to provide a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: to buy chickens, beans, and corn.

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en:
Alphonse, aged 38, is married and has six children. He would like to use his Kiva loan to buy fertilizers in order to increase his maize production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that, in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and to support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: La Señorita Elena tiene 18 años, ella se dedica  a la actividad del tejido de chompas y mantas de Alpaca para mujeres, tiene su taller y domicilio en la zona de  Sajama, esta es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  solicita este préstamo para la compra de una maquina de tejer ya que tiene muchos pedidos ya que ella realiza las prendas según  pedido, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incremento de capital de trabajo, La señorita Elena enfrenta retos en su negocio que son poder ofrecer sus productos en distintos mercados de la ciudad de El alto,  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando por mayor sus materiales para el tejido de sus chompas.
texts.en:
Elena, 19, makes a living knitting alpaca sweaters and blankets for women.  Her workshop and home are in the Sajama area.

This is Elena's first loan sequence with the institution.  She's requesting it to increase her capital for buying a knitting machine because she has a lot of orders and makes the garments on request.

The challenge Elena faces in her business is selling her products in different markets in the city of El Alto.  She's going to use the profits to continue making wholesale purchases of materials for knitting her sweaters.

loans.use: to buy a knitting machine

loans.name: Espoir Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Josephine est une commerçante avec une expérience de 16 ans et leader d’une Association d’Affaires  « Espoir ». Cliente  âgée de 32 ans et mère de 11 enfants qui étudient tous. La cliente est vendeuse de poissons.  Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de l’IMF Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 4 paniers de poissons. Son conjoint est un jardinier. Elle avait commencé  son entreprise avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite construire sa maison et scolariser ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables en leur donnant de crédit sans garantie matérielle,  surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
This client, Josephine, is a merchant with sixteen years of experience. She is the leader of a business association "Espoir", and she is 32 years old and a  mother of eleven children, of whom all are students. This client sells fish. She is requesting a loan from the microfinance institution Hekima to grow her business. She is going to purchase four baskets of fish. Her husband is a gardener. She had started her enterprise with funds from her husband. She would like to build her own house and to educate her children.

She thanks Hekima for its support of unbanked women entrepreneurs by according them loans without the need for collateral, especially during this critical time of war in the country's east.

loans.use: top purchase four baskets of fish

loans.name: Mujeres De Buena Vista Group

texts.es: La señora Ingrid Yolanda, quien se dedica a la venta de medicina  en general, nuevamente hace una solicitud de crédito porque le hacen falta varias medicinas en su pequeño negocio.  Desde hace 2 que se dedica a esta actividad y el sueño llegar a tener una farmacia en su comunidad ya que no hay, y así las personas no tener que subir  hasta el pueblo por un jarabe, colocación de sueros, ponerse inyecciones, y comprar una pastilla recetada por un doctor.  Varios medicamentos han subido de precio y el dinero que tiene no le alcanza y necesita nuevamente mas capital para poder comprar las medicinas que le faltan y no quedarles mal a las personas que confían en ella.este es el cuarto credito que esta solicitando ha trabajado 3 creditos anteriores y no a caido en mora, esperando nuevamente que le puedan ayudar.
texts.en:
Ingrid Yolanda earns a living by selling medicines. She is requesting a loan as there are various medicines that she doesn't have in her little business. She has been doing this for two years and her dream is to have a pharmacy in her community, as there are currently none. This would mean that people would not have to go in to town for syrups, serums, injections, and doctor-prescribed medicines. 

Several medicines have increased in price, and she does not currently have enough money. She needs more capital to buy the medicines that she doesn't have, and thus ensure that her clients continue to trust in her. 

This is the fourth loan that Ingrid has requested. She has had three previous loans and paid for them on time. She hopes that investors can help her once again.

loans.use: to buy medicines to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 32-year-old married woman from Naivasha county. She has two children, ages six and 12 years old.

Ruth has a business that she has been running for many years. She has applied for her second loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) to enable her to buy basins, brooms, and calling cards to add to her stock. She hopes to earn more profit after obtaining this loan. Ruth hopes to improve her standard of living in the near future.

loans.use: to buy basins, brooms, and calling cards for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet

loans.name: Saroen's Group

texts.en:
Saroen, 52, lives with her husband in a village in Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, Cambodia. She and her husband have been making a living by farming rice and growing cassava for several years. The current business earns her about 72,000 KHR per day. 

Saroem’s group consists of two members who live in the same village and are just with VisionFund this cycle. As group leader, Saroem is going to use her portion to pay for labor fees in harvesting cassava. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to pay for labor fees in harvesting cassava

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Ana Marlenee

texts.es: Ana, tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y reside en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, ella tiene un negocio donde vende ropa usada y nueva, zapatos, bolsos etc. Sus ventas las realiza en casa y de manera ambulante. Esta solicitando un  préstamo por 12,000 Lempiras para surtir de mercadería como ropa, calzado en esta temporada y obtener ganancias. Su meta es seguir trabajando con el negocio para hacerlo crecer y tener calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 53 years old, a single mother of two children, and lives in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes. She has always earned a living through sales. She has a business which sells new and used clothing, shoes, handbags, etc. She sells from her home and as a street vendor. 

She is requesting a loan of 12 000 Lempiras to stock up on merchandise such as clothing and seasonal footwear, and to make a profit. Ana's goal is to continue her business, and to grow it and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her business with clothing and footwear to sell.

loans.name: Onn's Group

texts.en:
Onn is 42 years old and living with her husband and four children in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district. Rice farming and raising chickens are the main source of her family’s income. They have been in these businesses for 10 years. The current business earns her family the daily income of about 70,000 KHR, and she is able to save 20,000 KHR each day. 

This is the fourth loan for Onn with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund Cambodia, and she completely paid back the past loans. Onn is now leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow more crops to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for farming.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan, opta por un nuevo crédito para invertir en la compra de llantas, dar mantenimiento al motor y reparar la caja de velocidades, de su unidad de transporte, de esta forma continuara dando un buen servicio y mucha seguridad a sus clientes.
El crédito anterior le facilito mejorar las condiciones de su unidad de trasporte y obtuvo como resultado mejores ingresos, mayor demanda de su servicio, su familia mantiene el mismo núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Juan has decided on a new loan to invest in buying tyres, maintaining the engine and repairing the gear box on his vehicle in order to continue giving good service and safety to his customers. 

The previous loan helped improve conditions in his vehicle and as a result he had improved income and greater demand for his service, his family remains the same nuclear family.

loans.use: to buy tyres, maintain the engine and repair the gear box.

loans.name: Maria Margoth

texts.es:
María, es una señora de 67 años que se dedica a vender tortillas, tiene tres hijos que ya han formado su propia familia, debido a la necesidad de tener mejore ingresos para cubrir sus gastos personales hace cinco años que se dedica a la venta de tortillas, lo hace de lunes a domingo, en esta actividad la apoya una de sus hijas.
Con el capital comprara maíz, leña y gas propano, lo que le ayudara a fortalecer su inventario para tener una mayor y mejor producción, espera aumentar el número de clientes así como también sus ganancias, con las que cancelara sus cuotas de la deuda.
Sueña con tener un negocio más rentable y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is a 67-year-old woman who sells tortillas for a living.  She has three children who now have their own families.  Five years ago she started her business selling tortillas because she needed more income to cover her personal expenses.  She works Monday through Sunday and one of her daughters helps her with her business.

With this capital she will buy corn, firewood, and propane gas, which will help her build up her inventory so she will have more and better output.  She hopes to increase her clientele as well as her profits, which she will use to make her loan payments.

She dreams of having a more profitable business and improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and propane gas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items to sell, including pure water, drinks, cigarettes and biscuits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase palm oil, rice, and cooking seasonings

loans.name: Jose Willian

texts.es:
José, es un agricultor dedicado a buscar el bienestar de su familia, actualmente está casado, vive junto a su esposa en casa de su madre, cultiva hortalizas y maíz, lo aprendió de su padre, trabaja todos los días.
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de abono, fertilizantes, insecticidas, semilla; con lo que podrá efectuar la preparación del terreno para sembrar sin inconvenientes, espera tener una mejor cosecha y mejorar sus ingresos.
Sueña con fortalecer el negocio, cumplir con los compromisos económicos y dar un mejor estilo de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
José is a farmer dedicated to the well-being of his family. He is married and lives with his wife in his mother's home. He grows vegetables and corn, which he learned from his father. He works every day.

The loan will be used to buy manure, fertilizer, insecticide, and seed, with which he will be able to easily prepare the land for planting. He hopes to have a better harvest and greater income.

He dreams of strengthening his business, meet his financial obligations, and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, insecticide, seeds.

loans.name: Rosarie

texts.fr: Rosaire est une femme de 55 ans, elle est veuve et mère de quatre enfants dont le plus âgé à 33 ans. En dehors de ses enfants, elle a la charge de deux autres enfants. Elle détient une menuiserie dans un quartier de la capital depuis quelques année déjà. Elle a une bonne connaissance du métier, de ses fournisseurs ainsi que de sa clientèle qu'elle à acquis au fil du temps. Cependant, elle fait très souvent face à des problèmes dus à la quantité de son peu suffisante de son stock qui ne lui permet pas de satisfaire convenablement sa clientèle. Pour palier à ce problème, Rosaire s'est tournée vers nous pour solliciter un financement. Les bénéfices qui résulteront de cette activité seront par la suite réinvestis et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Rosaire is a 55-year-old woman, a widow, and mother of four children, of whom the oldest is 33. Aside from her children, she supports two other children. Rosaire has owned a carpentry shop in a district in the capital for a few years already. She is very familiar with the trade and its suppliers, as well as her customers, whom she has acquired over the course of time. 

However, she is often faced with problems due to her barely adequate inventory, which prevents her from appropriately meeting the needs of her customers. To alleviate this problem, Rosaire turned toward us to request financing. The profits that will result from this business will then be reinvested, and the rest will enable her to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and equipment for her carpentry shop

loans.name: Lisbetth Karolina

texts.es: Lisbetth, es madre soltera, mantiene a su pequeño hijo quien cursa el tercer nivel de sus estudios, ella se desempeña en el sector legal como notificadora, Lisbetth habita en un barrio del municipio de Juigalpa, zona en la que no hay servicios de aguas negras, puesto que actualmente tiene la necesidad de construir un sumidero para empezar a poner inodoro, con el fin de ir mejorando las condiciones de vida para ella y su familia, es por eso que solicita el crédito para comprar los materiales como cemento, arena, hierro, bloques, piedrines, piedras cantera, mano de obra entre otros, esto podrá ser posible gracias al apoyo de crédito brindado en cuotas pequeñas, siendo ella una humilde mujer que gana un sueldo muy bajo, no puede asumir este gasto de un solo pago.
texts.en: Lisbetth is a single mother and she takes care of her young son, who is in the third year of his education. She works in the legal sector as a notary. Lisbetth lives in a municipal suburb of Juigalpa, an area in which there are no sewerage facilities, so she needs to build a drain for waste, with the aim of improving living conditions of her and her family and for this she is requesting a loan to buy materials like cement, sand, iron, bricks, stones, quarry stones and labourers among other things. This will be possible thanks to the loan offered in small amounts, as she is a humble woman with a low wage and does not think she could take on this expense on a single salary.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, bricks, stones, quarry stones, labourers and others.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.fr: Patrick est un homme de 46 ans il est père de six enfants dont l'âge vari entre 17 et 7 ans, tous vont encore à l'école. Il est commerçant et possède une petite parfumerie dans un marché de la cité capital depuis 10 ans déjà. son activité se déroule dans de bonne condition, mais il fait très souvent face au problème de rupture de stock. Pour faire face à ce problème, qu'il s'est tourné vers nous afin d'obtenir un financement. Patrick voudrait augmenter son stock pour répondre dans les délais et en quantité suffisante à la demande de sa clientèle avec l'approche des fêtes de fin d'année. Les bénéfices qui résulteront de cette activité seront en partie réinvestis et le reste lui permettra de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Patrick is a 46-year-old man and a father of six children, from 7 to 17 years old. All of the children are in school. Patrick is a merchant and has owned a small perfume shop at a market in the capital for ten years already. His business is developing well, but he very often copes with the problem of inventory shortages. To cope with this problem, he turned to us to obtain financing. 

Patrick would like to increase his inventory in time and in sufficient quantities to respond to the demands of his customers as the year-end holidays approach. The profits that will result from this business will in part be reinvested, and the rest will enable him to take care of his family.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of goods ahead of the year-end holidays

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel, 38, is a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rodolfo and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating their business. Maricel works hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

Maricel operates a variety store which, in the Philippines, is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Maricel earns an income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Maricel earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

Maricel is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan to help her continue operating her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Maricel dreams of expanding her business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 54 years old, is from Ndunyu Njeru. She is married to Peter; they have five children who are aged between 20 and 10 years old. 

Mary has operated a business selling secondhand for many years. She has applied for her seventh loan from KADET LTD. Mary is planning to use the money to buy more clothes to add to her stock for sale. She is optimistic that her business will do better after the loan. 

Mary hopes to open a boutique in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to add to her stock.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en: Rodrigo, 60 years old, is married and has nine children. Some of them are already married while his youngest child is still studying. Rodrigo manages a farming business for a living. He wanted to make his rice farming business grow abundantly but he had insufficient capital. Therefore, he is asking for additional revolving capital of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and herbicides used in farming. Rodrigo hopes to keep maintaining a good flow in his rice field so he can repay his loan in full.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides used in farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, cooking seasonings, and other stock for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking seasonings, and other stock for resale.

loans.name: Vaelua

texts.en: Vaelua is a 36-year-old woman with 4 children. She owns and operates a business, sewing and selling elei dresses, ielavalava (a traditional Polynesian cloth worn as a skirt by men and women) and t-shirts. She has 2 years of experience in this line of business. Vaelua needs a loan to buy an overlock sewing machine, materials, fabric, color paint, elei carved board, brushes and stencils. She hopes to use her profits to support her family. Vaelua joined SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine, materials, fabric, color paint, elei carved board, brushes and stencils

loans.name: Sunui

texts.en: Sunui, 40 years old, is married and has 1 child. She owns and operates a sewing business and has 3 years of experience. Sunui needs a loan to buy threads, a set of roll materials, an overlock machine and dozens of buttons. She hopes to use her profits to improve her business and to help her family matters. She joined SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy threads, a set of roll materials, an overlock machine and dozens of buttons

loans.name: Sary

texts.en:
Sary, who is 51 years old, is married, with eight children.  She lives in a rural village located in the Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district, Cambodia. 

For the past 32 years, she has been farming rice while her husband buys and sells old houses in the village. The current business earns them about USD 21 per day, but they can save about USD 10 each day after daily expenses. 

Sary is just with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is applying for a loan. 

With this loan, she is going to buy an old house to resell. She hopes this loan will enable her family to earn more income for her family so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy an old house to resell

loans.name: William Alberto

texts.es:
William de 43 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado. Actualmente, esta separado, tiene 2 hijas las cuales viven con la mamá;  él vive solo y  les ayuda económicamente a sus dos hijas.


Él es motorista, posee un carro donde realiza viajes a diferentes partes de la ciudad y alrededores, desde hace tres años.  Antes de esto era motorista de un bus y decidió comprase un carrito y poner su propio negocio. Desde sus casa le queda como ha medio kilómetro, desde donde él hace meta. Trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde. 


El préstamo que esta soliictando, es para arreglar el carro, ya que le esta dando problemas. Con él préstamo se le ayudara a que lo arregle y siga trabajando y no se quede varado. 

Los sueños de William, son ver a sus dos hijas profesionales y mas adelante comprarse un carrito mejor para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
William is 43 years old. He studied until sixth grade. He is currently separated, and has 2 daughters who live with their mother. He lives alone and he gives financial support to his 2 daughters.  

William is a taxi driver. He owns a car which, for the past 3 years, he has used to make trips to different parts of the city and surrounding regions. He used to be a bus driver. He later decided to buy a car and establish his own business. The area where he collects fares is about a half a kilometre from his home. He works from 8:00 am until 5 pm. 

He is requesting a loan to repair his car because he has been having car trouble. The loan will enable him to fix the car so that he can keep working without the car breaking down. 

His dreams include seeing his 2 daughters become professionals and, in the future, buying a better car to continue working.

loans.use: to repair his car because he has been having car trouble.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 48 years old and from Naivasha.  She is married with three children, who are aged between 15 years and 25 years old. 

Mary has a hotel business that she has been running for the past two years.  She has applied for his third loan from KADET LTD, to enable her buy more seats, firewood, and cooking ingredients to be used in her hotel. She is optimistic that her hotel will do well.

She hopes to own a bigger hotel in the near future.

loans.use: To buy seats, firewood, and cooking ingredients for her hotel

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 46 years old and married with four children.

Melanie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like sugar, soft drinks, soap, chips, eggs, etc. to sell.

Melanie has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Melanie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like sugar, soft drinks, soap, chips, eggs, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more plastic slippers for resale.

loans.name: Tuya

texts.en: Tuya, 43 years old, lives with her three children, son-in-law and grandson in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a janitor at a private firm since 2010. Her younger daughter studies economics at the university and her son goes to high school. Her elder daughter has a position of manager at a private firm and her son-in-law is a cook at a restaurant. The house they live in has been deteriorated over the years and can't accommodate all of them appropriately. Tuya is requesting a loan of 6,000,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials for house renovation and expansion. By doing so, her family shall live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Auro

texts.en: Auro is 43 years old and married with 6 children. She has a business venture sewing different clothes to earn a living and has been doing this for 4 years. Auro has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, rolls of material and dozens of buttons. She plans to use her profits to upgrade her business and support her family. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, rolls of material and dozens of buttons.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 48 years old and married to Austine. They have seven children, three of whom are in school.

Lucy used her profits to buy more clothes and her business did well. She has applied for a second loan and is planning to buy calves to use in her farm which is her secondary business. Lucy is happy that the loans are really enabling her businesses to do well.

She hopes to diversify into dairy farming in the near future.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Marufakhon

texts.ru: Маруфахон родилась в 1972 году. Она порядочная женщина. Маруфахон замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Маруфахон занимается скотоводством уже более 5 лет. Она имеет 8 голов коровы. Она продает молоко, кефир, сметану и другие молочные продукты. Маруфахону помогают ее дети и невестки введению бизнеса. Она имеет своих постоянных клиентов благодаря высокому качеству ее продукции. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Маруфахон должна выдать замуж свою дочь, но не имеет достаточно денег, для покупки, приданной для своей дочери, и провести ее свадебное торжество. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества своей дочери. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Marufakhon was born in 1972.  She's an honest and respectable woman who is married and raising 4 children.  Marufakhon's husband is currently a migrant worker in Russia, whereas she's a dairy farmer in Tajikistan; she's been at it for more than 5 years, selling milk, kefir, sour cream, and a number of other dairy products, and currently has 8 cows on her farm.  Her children and daughters-in-law help tend to the farm, and she has a number of regular customers thanks to the high quality of her dairy products.

Marufakhon is preparing for her daughter's upcoming wedding, but lacks the money to buy everything necessary for one.  As such, she's seeking a loan of 5,000 somoni to pay for her daughter's wedding reception, and is counting on your kindness and charity.

loans.use: pay for her daughter's wedding reception

loans.name: Ibodat

texts.ru: Ибодат родилась в 1959 году. Она трудолюбивая женщина. Ибодат имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Она работает в средней школе. Ибодат преподает географию. Она очень любит свою профессию. Ибодат воспитывает 3 детей. Ее муж предоставляет услуги такси. Ибодат и ее семья живут бедно. Они не имеют денег, чтобы отремонтировать их дом. Их дом имеет плохое состояние. Ибодат запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 долларов США для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Ibodat was born in 1959.  She is a hardworking woman.  Ibodat has a higher, pedagogical education.  She works at a secondary school.  Ibodat teaches geography.  She loves her work very much.  Ibodat is raising three children.  Her husband provides a taxi service.  Ibodat and her family live in poverty.  They do not have money to repair their house.  Their house is in a bad condition.  Ibodat is requesting a loan in the amount of 2000 US dollars to purchase construction materials, such as cement, wood, etc.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials, such as cement, wood, etc., in order to repair her house

loans.name: Jaime Arcenio

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 29 años de edad estado civil casado vive con su esposa y sus hijos de 8, 7, 8 y 3 años, Vive en el  Cantón Pueblo viejo provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama LA PAULINA se encuentra ubicada en el parroquia Puerto Pechiche recinto La Paulina, pertenece al cantón Pueblo esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Jaime se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y a la cría de animales  desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas en Agroquímica Karlita y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.
El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo y para invertir. Su sueño es comprar una maquina agrícola como un tractor.
Le gusta jugar futbol y reunirse con su familia.
texts.en:
Jaime is 29-years old, married and lives with his wife and three children, who are 8, 7, and 3-years old respectively.  He lives in Pueblo Canton in the old Ríos Province.
His communal bank is called "La Paulina" and is located in Puerto Pechiche parish, La Paulina precinct, which belongs to Pueblo canton.  The members of this communal bank make their livings in agriculture and ranching. 
Jaime makes his living in agriculture.  He has been growing corn and rice and raising animals.for the last few years.  He purchases his supplies in Agroquímica Karlita in Ventanas and sells his products in the Ventanas markets. 
Jaime is requesting the loan to purchase compost, urea and liquid fertilizers for his corn and rice.  The loans help him to increase his income for personal use and to re-invest in his business.  Jaime's dream is to purchase an agricultural machine, like a tractor. 
Jaime likes to play soccer and to get together with his family.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Mezair

texts.en: Mezair is 40 years old. He has a business of selling clothing out of his home. He sells children's clothes. He buys the clothing from another city during weekly trips. He said that he started this business three years ago with money that he had earned from a previous job. Mezair is married and the father of three children. His wife works as a teacher at the local school. His mother is a pensioner and lives with them. His mother has health problems. She has an illness that requires bed rest and so Mezair covers doctor services at home. Because of this, he has applied for the loan.

loans.use: to pay for health treatment.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is a 27-year-old man who operates a spare parts business in Rukungiri in Rukungiri District. He lives with his two sisters, who are orphans. 
Innocent started his business in 2008 after the death of his parents. As the caretaker and head of the family, he has to earn enough income to cater to his family's needs and pay for his sisters' school fees. 

Innocent's major clients are taxi owners and drivers, motorcycle (bodaboda) cyclists, and mechanics. He is hardworking and honest. His customers trust him.

Innocent will use the loan to expand his business and become a wholesaler. This will allow him to earn more money, which he needs to pay school fees, as his sisters are enrolling in higher institutions of learning.
