The increase in income she expects from the business, she will use to improve the daily living conditions of the family. She will be grateful to all the lenders for their goodwill in helping her develop her agribusiness.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Sipho's Group

texts.en: Sipho, aged 26 and a mother of two children, is residing in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. To support her two dependent kids who are still young, she does paddy rice farming on three hectares and works for others for a fee to earn extra income. Sipho, a first time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) is leading a group of two to get a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay the reaping fee for her rice crop. She hopes to collect a high yield with a good income in return.

loans.use: to pay the reaping fee for her rice crop

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jenalyn works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns income from motorcycle transport. Jenalyn is borrowing 29,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets for her fishing business.

Jenalyn has sustained her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham is a 60-year-old widow who has been working in selling women's and children's clothes and underwear to make her living and cover her needs since her husband passed away two years ago.  Siham is well known in her region with her special quality and prices. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to  increase her business merchandise with a special Christmas and winter collection that will fulfill her customers' needs and increase her income.
She hopes to keep on developing and improving her business to make sure that she'll have a financially secure future since she has no one to rely on concerning this matter.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with a special Christmas and winter collection that will fulfill her customers' needs and increase her income

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a farmer in Oloitoktok town where he plants cash crops for selling. He is 45 years old and married. Together with his spouse they have been blessed with four children. He has been in the farming business for 12 years and right now his monthly income is KES 9,500. He will use this loan to buy fertilizer and agrochemicals for use in his farm. This will enable him to get more yield. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. 

In future Benson hopes to be a successful farmer and to give his children a good education.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and agrochemicals.

loans.name: Jenta

texts.en:
Jenta is a married woman with four children. She lives at her own house that has no electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She operates a food selling business to passersby and neighbors. She mentioned the high cost of purchasing foodstuffs as her major challenge and that is the reason for her request so that she can add capital. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Rachael is 45 years old. She is single and has two children who she supports. Rachael was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet staff member and she is taking her fourth loan from KADET of KES 60,000.  She has a second hand clothes shop which has lasted five years now and earns monthly income of KES 18,000.  Her previous loan of KES 40,000 was repaid successfully. She will use her loan to buy more second hand clothes. Also, she will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her future business are to open a wholesale shop and make sure her children live well.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand clothes to sell to her buyers.

loans.name: Unidos Al Futuro Group

texts.es: Jaquelin  tiene 31 años es casada con 02 hijos menores. En el grupo “UNIDOS AL FUTURO” cumple la función de secretaria. Ella se dedica a la venta de cervezas y gaseosas en su domicilio. Y adicionalmente presta servicios de auxiliar en un centro educativo.  De esta manera puede apoyar a su es posos con los gastos de su familia. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de más cerveza y gaseosas. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Jaquelin es la segunda del lado derecho y de la misma manera esta incluida la foto de Zosima en la parte superior derecha que no pudo estar presente en la reunión por motivos de salud.
texts.en:
Jaquelin is 31 years old. She has two young children and is a secretary in the group Unidos al Futuro. She works selling beer and soft drinks in her home and additionally, works as an assistant at a school. This allows her to support her husband with the family expenses.

She will buy more beer and soft drinks with the loan. The group is grateful to the Kiva investors for the loan. Jaquelin is the second on the right. In the top-right corner is Zosima who could not attend the meeting for health reasons.

loans.use: to buy beer and soft drinks

loans.name: Amygail

texts.en:
Amygail previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase more stock and more types of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education and for her personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another loan, for 12,000 PHP, to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help meet her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Amygail hopes that her business will last longer and dreams that her family will always be in good health. She meets with her co-fellowship members every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 42-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as a focused and determined person. 

Grace operates a vet business where she offers artificial insemination, animal treatment, etc. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a place with much potential and her customers are primarily livestock owners. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of funds to buy medicine for animals. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more medicine for treating animals. 

Grace hopes that she will have a bright future. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy medicine for clients' animals

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 58 years old and married, with four children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Elsa has been farming vegetables for ten years and also earns income from selling purified drinking water.

Elsa is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en:
Ernest is 32 years old. He is a father of two children aged six and sixteen. He has spent eight years in farming. With the loan, he would like to buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With the profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during maize production.

loans.name: Jacob's Group

texts.en:
Jacob is a member of Imani WG Group in Chwele District.  He is pictured here in a group of 6 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 70 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Jacob has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.							

Jacob is a reliable member of the community. He is married with four children. Jacob is 34 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 10 years to support his family.  In addition to this, Jacob is very active in his community and is involved in the men's group and savings group.  He described his harvest last year as excellent.  He hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and enjoying the success he is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.							

Jacob first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2009 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Jacob joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, fertilizer and hybrid seeds.  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader and an active community member.  Jacob plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to repair the home and buy a cow.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Jacob’s own life was improved because he has more farm training and more farm group support. 

Jacob and the Imani WG Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.	

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to access hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is 34 years old and she lives in Koghes village in Lori region. Hasmik is not married and she lives with her parents and her brother. Hasmik works at the school as a teacher of mathematics and IT. She is a very clever and kind person, who is seriously engaged in the education process. As she says, her work demands great knowledge and forbearance, love towards children and sureness that someday, in some place her pupils will remember her words and given knowledge and use it positively. Hasmik’s mother is also a teacher and they work together at the same school. 
Hasmik asks for a loan of 400,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a computer and some professional literature. This purchase will be very useful both for Hasmik and her mother as well.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some professional literature

loans.name: Armen

texts.en: Armen is an experienced agronomist from Nor Kesaria village. He lives together with his mother, wife and two school age children aged 15 and 12 years old.  Armen owns a farm where he keeps two cows and cultivates land. He cultivates wheat and corn and sells the harvest in the local market.  Nonetheless, Armen hasn't been able to save enough money to care for the needs of his family and, at the same time, to cover the upkeep of his farm. He has applied for this loan to purchase three oxen, fertilizer and fuel.  Realizing the importance of the income that Armen gathers from agribusiness, the loan will greatly assist Armen to enlarge the farm and ensure a better life for his family. He will be very grateful to the lenders for support.

loans.use: to purchase three oxen, fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Farida was born in 1959. She is married and has a daughter. Her daughter is 25 years old and she is married. Farida began her business selling children's clothes 30 years ago. Little by little she developed her business skills and abilities. Now, Farida sells fabrics in a local market. She has regular customers. Farida is going to buy goods for the new season but she does not have enough money. She is asking for a loan of 4000 TJS to buy fabrics for the new season. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Balbina

texts.en:
This is Balbina. She previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Balbina dreams of being more successful in her business and hopes that her children will have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables, and products needed in her business

loans.name: Eduard

texts.en:
Eduard is 55 years old and he lives in Kapan city in Syunik region. Eduard is the father of three very nice girls. For many years he worked at the shoe factory, but after it was closed he established his own business. Using his own car he provides transport for people in the territory of Kapan. He has a lot of loyal customers who always trust him and know that despite driving long distances they are safe and comfortable. Eduard is the only bread-winner in his family, so he tries always to keep his car in order and clean, but with the coming of winter he has some problems connected with his car tires. 
He asks for a loan of 250,000 Armenian drams in order to buy tires for his car for the winter season.

loans.use: to buy tires for his car for the winter season

loans.name: Erimina

texts.en: Erimina is a hard working woman. She supports her family through her food-selling business. The previous loan helped her to buy food consumables to sell. She is again requesting another loan of KES 20,000 to buy sugar, salt, soap, maize flour and rice to add stock to her business. She appreciates the support from Kiva and Yehu.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, soap, maize flour and rice to add stock to her business

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en:
Kabero SHG is a group of four group leader farmers in Chwele District with Betty selected as the Kiva representative.  Betty has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with her hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to her and the 42 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.

Betty is a reliable member of the community.  She is married with six children.  Betty is 42 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 20 years to support her family.  In addition to this, Betty is very active in her community and is involved in the women's group.  She described her harvest last year as good and hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund to enjoy the success she is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.
							
The 2014 Long Rains season won’t be Betty’s first season with One Acre Fund.  She first joined One Acre Fund in 2007 and has continued working with One Acre Fund in order to get fertilizer and hybrid seeds.  As an active member in her community, Betty also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she likes being a leader and wants to help more farmers.  Betty plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school.  Her life has improved by working with One Acre Fund because she has more farm training, more farm group support, and is able to save money and feed the family.							
	
Betty and the Kabero SHG Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to increase their harvests of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Coumba's Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc villageois de Diatamine Saféré est né le 15 décembre 2008 à l'inauguration du Banc villageois. Les membres du groupe habitent le même village  et sont animés d’un esprit d’entre aide et de soutien mutuel. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et la transformation des produits locaux.

Madame Coumba  (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 59 ans, mariée  et mère de huit  enfants dont cinq garçons et trois filles. Elle achète des graines d’arachide et autres céréales qu’elle transforme en vu de la revente dans les différents marchés dans sa zone surtout au marché international de la sous région.

 Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter des céréales et particulièrement de la patte d’arachide pour la transformation et la vente.

 
Les bénéfices lui permettront d’assurer les besoins familiales (habillement, santé, scolarité, nourriture).
texts.en:
The "banc villageois" of Diatamine Saféré was formed December 15, 2008. The members of the group live in the same village and are motivated by a desire for helping each other and mutual aid. They are in the primary business of producing local products.

Coumba (pictured sitting on the far right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group and its representative. She is 59 years old, married and the mother of eight children, five boys and three girls. She purchases peanuts and other cereals which she processes in order to resell them in different markets in her area, especially the international market of the sub-region. 

This new loan will allow Coumba to purchase cereals, especially peanut paste, to process and resell. The profits will allow her to provide for her family's needs (clothing, health, education, and food.)

loans.use: to purchase cereals and specifically peaut paste to process and resell

loans.name: Kakule

texts.fr: Le Client Kakule est un fonctionnaire dans une organisation évangélique baptiste. Il est parent de 2 étudiants à l’université, tous en première année de graduat  respectivement dans les facultés d’économie et de sante publique. Il a été informé des nouvelles opportunités de financement de frais académiques par l’IMF Hekima. Ainsi, ce nouveau prêt lui servira de payer les frais académiques pour ces 2 étudiants (fille et garçon) en fin qu’ils ne soient plus exclus de cours durant toute l’année académique 2013-2014. Ce parent fonctionnaire, rêve voir sa fille et son fils devenir hauts cadres en santé publique et chef d’entreprise. Il remercie l’IMF Hekima pour son nouveau produit innovant  dédiés  à l’éducation de leurs enfant en leur donnant de crédit d’impact social  surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
This client, Kakule, is a staff member in a Baptist evangelical organization. He is the parent of two students at the university level. Both are in their freshman year in economics and in public health, respectively. Kakule was informed about new opportunities in the financing of education costs by the microfinance institution Hekima. 

Thus, this new loan will be used to pay the education costs for these two students (a boy and a girl), so that they are no longer excluded from classes throughout the 2013-14 academic year. This parent staff member dreams of seeing his daughter and son as a high-ranking public health worker and a company manager. 

He thanks the microfinance institution Hekima very much for its new innovative product dedicated to their children's education through lending with social impact, especially during this critical time of war in the country's east.

loans.use: to pay the education costs for two students

loans.name: Bahozi

texts.fr: Le Client Bahozi est un docteur, médecin expérimenté travaillant dans une  Fondation d’œuvre Médicale. Il est parent de 3 étudiants à l’université (respectivement une fille en G1 Technologie appliquée, 1 garçon en première licence en droit  public et 1 garçon en G3 économie). Il a été informé des nouvelles opportunités de financement de frais académiques par l’IMF Hekima. Ainsi, ce nouveau prêt lui servira de payer les frais académiques pour ces 3 étudiants en fin qu’ils ne soient plus exclus de cours durant toute l’année académique 2013-2014. Ce parent médecin, rêve voir sa fille devenir ingénieur architecte et ses deux fils hauts cadres magistrat et chef d’entreprise.  Il remercie l’IMF Hekima pour son nouveau produit innovant  dédiés  à l’éducation de leurs enfants en leur donnant de crédit d’impact social  surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
This client, Bahozi, is an experienced doctor working in a medical foundation. He is the parent of three students at the university level (respectively a daughter in the G1 applied technology track, a son in undergraduate studies in public law, and a son in the G3 economics track). Bahozi was informed about new opportunities in the financing of education costs by the microfinance institution Hekima. 

Thus, this new loan will be used to pay the education costs for these three students, so that they are no longer excluded from classes throughout the 2013-14 academic year. This parent physician dreams of seeing his daughter become an architect-engineer and his two sons become an attorney and a company manager. 

He thanks the microfinance institution Hekima for its new innovative product dedicated to their children's education through lending with social impact, especially during this critical time of war in the country's east.

loans.use: to pay the education costs for three students

loans.name: Xuan's Group

texts.en:
Xuan was born in 1961 in Dong Anh, Hanoi. She and her husband own a small grocery store, which generates a monthly income of 7,000,000 VND.  Now, she is facing the problem of capital shortage to maintain her family business. Thus, she would love to borrow 6,758,000 VND to restock her grocery store. This is the second time Xuan has participated in the SEDA program. The revenue collected from the shop will be spent on improving her family's living conditions. 

Xuan is the leader of a group of 5 members. Similar to Xuan, the other members also want to borrow money to invest in their family businesses. 

Hue is a 51-year-old farmer. She would love to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in her small vegetable selling business. 

Nhan is a 45-year-old business woman. She would love to borrow 8,938,000 VND for her vegetable shop.

Thom is 31 years old. She is a fishmonger. For the purpose of expanding her business, she would love to borrow 7,630,000 VND.

Mai is 37 years old. She is currently a worker. However, she would like to borrow 6,322,000 VND to raise chickens and provide more income for her family.

loans.use: to restock her grocery store

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani is 43 years old and married with four children.

Lani works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

Lani has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twelve years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Lani aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a 29-year-old single woman. She has one child who is five years old. She describes herself as a determined person. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years. 

Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are small-scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low sales. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to add a stock of clothes for resale. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. 

This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add a stock of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 65 years old and has nine children; she works very hard to provide for them.

Lydia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, milk, noodles, eggs, etc. 

Lydia has been in this business for two years.

In the future Lydia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, milk, noodles and eggs.

loans.name: Clemence

texts.en: Clemence appreciates the previous loan that helped her to buy a stock of clothes for her business. Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of Kshs 20,000 to add stock of second-hand clothes for sale to get income and support her family.

loans.use: to add to her stock of second-hand clothes for sale

loans.name: Kibet

texts.en:
Kibet is a 23-year-old single man. He describes himself as confident. He operates a retail business where he sells bread, milk, eggs, drinks and other items. He has been involved in this business for four years. 

His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are small-scale. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of bread, soap, drinks and other items. His business goal is to be successful within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add a stock of bread, soap, drinks and other items.

loans.name: Solidario Mary De Patzun Group

texts.es: Solidario Mary de patzun La señora Andrea se dedica a la  venta de  pan,pasteles,y como actividad secundaria se dedica a la venta de tamales tiene 3 años de dedicarse a esta actividad y esta solicitando este credito para la compra de arina y meteriales para la elaboracion de pan y pasteles esperando que ustedes le puedan ayudar con el credito que esta solicitando ya que el anhelo de ella es tener un negocio mas grande y darles a sus hijo todo el estudio que nececitan.
texts.en:
Andrea is a member of the Solidario Mary de Patzun group and she sells bread, pastry, and as a second activity she also sells tamales.

She has engaged in this activity for three years and she is asking for a loan in order to buy flour and other products to make bread and pastry. She hopes that you can help her with the loan she is asking for, because it is her aim to have a bigger business and to enable her children to go to school for as long as they need.

loans.use: to buy flour and other products to make and sell bread and pastry.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is a 28-year-old single woman. She has one child. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for three years. 

Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are small-scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to buy more stock. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add a stock of vegetables and fruits. Her business goal is to have a self-reliant business within five years. 

This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add a stock of vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Berlina

texts.en:
As a married parent of eleven children, Berlina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling dried coconut meat.  Berlina is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials for her fishing business.

Berlina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 42 years old. She is a married mother of two children, who are both in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Lourdes has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Lourdes requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Lourdes has been in this business for six years. In the future, Lourdes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is 34 years old and married with six children, five of whom are in school. Amelia works very hard to provide for them.

Amelia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, spices, etc.

Amelia has been in this business for seven years.

In the future Amelia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk and spices.

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah works hard to support her family. Jonah is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Jonah requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, chips, eggs, noodles, etc.

Jonah has been in this business for a year now.

In the future, Jonah would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, chips, eggs and noodles.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lorena is 39 years old and has three children who are in school.

Lorena has a general store business in the Philippines. Lorena requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like snack foods, sugar, shampoo and other items.

Lorena has been in this business for two years. In the future, Lorena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like snack foods, sugar, shampoo and other items.

loans.name: Dienabou's Group

texts.fr:
Créé le 29 juin 2008 à l’inauguration du banc villageois, ce groupe est composé de femmes qui ont une expérience dans le programme des bancs villageois. Elles sont toutes issues du même village et partageant des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Diènabou (en médaillon en haut et à droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 34 ans et mère de trois filles et un garçon. Comme la majorité des femmes de la zone elle s’active dans la vente et la transformation d’arachide qu’elle achète dans les marchés hebdomadaires de la zone pour la transformation et la revente.

Avec son crédit, elle compte acheter le sac à 7 000 F CFA moyennant 800 F CFA de frais de transport par sac et  des frais de transformation de 1250 F CFA le sac.

Elle peut obtenir en moyen des bénéfices nets de 9 000 F CFA tous les dix jours ce qui lui permette d’apporter sa contribution dans les charges de la maison et la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
This group and "banc villageois" were created on 29 June 2008.  The group is made up of women who have a lot of experience working with the "banc villageois".

The women all come from the same village, and are very closely linked through working together and helping one another.  They all work in small businesses.

Diènabou (on the right of the photo, and in the inset photo) is the loan representative.  She is married and has three daughters and a son.  Like most of the women in the area, she processes and sells peanuts.  She buys her supplies at the local weekly markets, and processes them before reselling them.

Diènabou will use her loan to buy peanuts.  She pays 7,000 francs CFA per sack, 800 francs CFA per sack for transportation, and it costs 1,250 francs CFA to process the nuts.  She can earn a net profit of 9,000 francs CFA every ten days.  In this way, she contributes to the running costs of her household, and the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy, transport, process and resell peanuts.

loans.name: Maria Marta

texts.es: María de 41 años de edad  es madre de dos hijas de 20 años y  17 años de edad. Habita en casa humilde pero propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus queridos hijos.   María trabaja como empleada doméstica desde hace  mucho tiempo y de esta forma es como junto a su compañero de vida mantienen la economía del hogar. Desea mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales por lo que ha solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo del corredor y para encementar el piso de la vivienda. Con el crédito pretende comprar lámina galvanizada, cemento, arena y grava. De esta forma espera mejor sus condiciones habitacionales y las de su familia.
texts.en:
María is 41 years old and has two daughters, who are 20 and 17 years old. She lives in a house which is humble but her own, together with her live-in partner and her beloved children.

María has been working as a domestic employee for many years, and in this way she and her partner cover the household expenses. She wants to improve their living conditions and therefore is asking for this loan with FUSAI, in order to repair the roof of the hallway and to put a concrete floor into their house. With the loan she wants to buy metal sheets, cement, sand and gravel. By this she hopes to improve the living conditions of her own and of her family.

loans.use: To buy: metal sheets, cement, sand, and gravel to repair the roof and to put a concrete floor into the hallway.

loans.name: Maria Hilda

texts.es: María de 60 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y su hijo quien ya es mayor de edad y le ayuda con los gatos diarios. María trabaja en un comedor como ayudante en oficios varios. Tienen mucho tiempo de trabajar en este lugar y es así como ha llevado el pan de cada día a su hogar.  Con mucho esfuerzo construyó su vivienda junto a su esposo, y esta es su principal patrimonio por lo que poco a poco va mejorando. Desea terminar de construir un cuarto que comenzó y no logro dar fin. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, ladrillo, arena, hierro, grava y arena para continuar la construcción y finalizarla lo antes posible.
texts.en:
María is 60 years old and lives in her own house, together with her husband and their son, who is already grown up and helps with the daily expenses.

María works as a help for various tasks in a restaurant. She has worked in this place for a long time and by this has provided for the household. With great effort she built the house together with her husband, and this is her main asset which she wants to improve bit by bit. She wants to finish the construction of the room she started butcould not complete it yet. Therefore, she is asking for this loan with FUSAI in order to use it to buy cement, bricks, sand, steel, and gravel in order to continue the construction and finish it as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy: cement, bricks, sand, steel, and gravel to complete the construction of a room.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Eden works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tricycle transportation. Eden is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy kitchen wares and ingredients for her food business.

Eden has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy kitchen wares and ingredients for her food business.
